ResponsesInList.Title: Configurable Reports - adding in a filter based on a custom user profile field
ResponsesInList.Text: I have a user profile field with the shortname of 'gender' - this is a Drop down menu, where the options are: Male Female Other Prefer not to say I want to add a gender filter to a report, where the 4 options appear as a drop down in the filter and selecting one then filters by that selection. This feels to me like it should be really easy, but I cannot work out the syntax. How do I do this?

ResponsesInList.Title: Configurable Reports - adding in a filter based on a custom user profile field
ResponsesInList.Text: There are two tables to reference - this was in the help docs... SELECT * FROM prefix_user AS u JOIN prefix_user_info_data AS uid ON uid.userid = u.id JOIN prefix_user_info_field AS uif ON (uid.fieldid = uif.id AND uif.shortname = 'class') WHERE `deleted` = "1" and `institution`="your school name" and `department` = "your department" and `data` = "class level and number"

ResponsesInList.Title: Configurable Reports - adding in a filter based on a custom user profile field
ResponsesInList.Text: Thanks Emma for replying - I have got the basic report created fine, the bit I am stuck on is adding in the filters that appear to the end user, so they can filter the report. For example, I have managed to successfully add in a date range filter, and the following SQL code will then apply what I need, but I cannot do the same with a custom user profile field filter. WHERE u.deleted = 0 AND cmc.timemodified > %%STARTTIME%% AND cmc.timemodified < %%ENDTIME%%

ResponsesInList.Title: Configurable Reports - adding in a filter based on a custom user profile field
ResponsesInList.Text: Show us your code. And try the %%FILTER_USERS:d.data%% filter ( https://moodle.org/mod/forum/discuss.php?d=226805#p1381510 )

ResponsesInList.Title: Configurable Reports - adding in a filter based on a custom user profile field
ResponsesInList.Text: The query is part of a sub query, which is quite complex, but I have simplified it here, to make it more understandable: This basic query will list the times that users have completed activites, and return their name, country, gender and 'age range' (the bigger query is doing counts of these numbers - but that isn't important here). SELECT u.firstname, u.lastname, u.country, uid.data AS "Gender", uid2.data As "AgeRange", cmc.timemodified AS "first_completion_time" FROM prefix_course_modules_completion AS cmc JOIN prefix_course_modules AS cm ON cm.id = cmc.coursemoduleid JOIN prefix_course AS c ON c.id = cm.course JOIN prefix_user AS u ON u.id = cmc.userid JOIN prefix_user_info_data AS uid ON uid.userid = u.id JOIN prefix_user_info_field AS uif ON uid.fieldid = uif.id JOIN prefix_user_info_data AS uid2 ON uid2.userid = u.id JOIN prefix_user_info_field AS uif2 ON uid2.fieldid = uif2.id WHERE u.deleted = 0 AND u.suspended = 0 AND uif.shortname = "gender" AND uif2.shortname = "agerange" ---- If I add the following line to the bottom of the query: AND uid.data = "Female" Then the report will filter to show only people whose gender is 'Female'. What I want to be able to do is to swap that line for something like: AND uid.data = %%FILTER_profile_gender%% so that it picks up whatever has been selected in the 'gender' filter that I have added (this is a dropdown filter pulling the data from the custom user field with shortname = 'gender'. I have managed to get date range filters to work with this approach, but I cannot work out the syntax required for a user profile field. Any help would be really appreciated.

ResponsesInList.Title: Configurable Reports - adding in a filter based on a custom user profile field
ResponsesInList.Text: Is the name of your custom profile filed "gender"? This won't work: AND uid.data = %%FILTER_profile_gender%% Instead it would be like this at the end of your sql query: %%FILTER_USERS: uid.data%% (leave out the "AND uid.data =" part) That should work because you can only filter on one uid.data value, i.e. on one custom profile field. See https://moodle.org/mod/forum/discuss.php?d=427857#p1722879 for an example of how it was done there.

ResponsesInList.Title: Configurable Reports - adding in a filter based on a custom user profile field
ResponsesInList.Text: Hi Luis - thanks for responding, I managed to eventually end up with the solution that you have suggested, and in doing so, realised that I would only ever be able to apply one such filter at a time, which is a shame as wanted to have 3 such filters in the report, but it looks like that isn't possible.

ResponsesInList.Title: Configurable Reports - adding in a filter based on a custom user profile field
ResponsesInList.Text: Great. Can you share your working code? Being restricted to just one filter is a horrible limitation. Unfortunately, new feature development on this Configurable Reports plugin seems to have have stopped...

ResponsesInList.Title: Configurable Reports - adding in a filter based on a custom user profile field
ResponsesInList.Text: The final working code is as per below, and as you say a real shame that it isn't possible to filter on mor than one custom profile field. SELECT u.firstname, u.lastname, u.country, uid.data AS "Gender", uid2.data As "AgeRange", cmc.timemodified AS "first_completion_time" FROM prefix_course_modules_completion AS cmc JOIN prefix_course_modules AS cm ON cm.id = cmc.coursemoduleid JOIN prefix_course AS c ON c.id = cm.course JOIN prefix_user AS u ON u.id = cmc.userid JOIN prefix_user_info_data AS uid ON uid.userid = u.id JOIN prefix_user_info_field AS uif ON uid.fieldid = uif.id JOIN prefix_user_info_data AS uid2 ON uid2.userid = u.id JOIN prefix_user_info_field AS uif2 ON uid2.fieldid = uif2.id WHERE u.deleted = 0 AND u.suspended = 0 AND u.country = "GB" AND uif.shortname = "gender" AND uif2.shortname = "agerange" %%FILTER_USERS:uid.data%%

ResponsesInList.Title: Configurable Reports - adding in a filter based on a custom user profile field
ResponsesInList.Text: This is a total guess and I haven't tried it! What happens if you try adding two filters, like: %%FILTER_USERS:uid.data%% %%FILTER_USERS:uid2.data%%

I want to display the report results in the source code format so I can precise URL content. I have several successful reports that are designed to search content across books, pages, text areas, etc. My issue is that I cannot see the raw URL in the report results, which instead shows me the produced page content. An example of one of my queries is below. 
```text
SELECT prefix_page.name as PageName, prefix_page.content as PageContent, 
  prefix_course.id as courseID, prefix_course.shortname as CourseName

INNER JOIN prefix_course ON (prefix_course.id = prefix_page.course)
```

ResponsesInList.Title: query for average fraction of all the questions in the question bank
ResponsesInList.Text: Hi I was wondering if anyone has a suggestion for the following query: I want to build a report to display the average score of each question in the question bank (these questions are used in separate courses). My main problem seems to be the number of rows in the question_attempt_steps table (over 10 million!) due to the large number of questions (several thousand) and the large number of attempts (more than several thousand ...). As a result, the query I've designed never finishes and keeps running without any results. Is there perhaps a better way of constructing such a query? Thanks for your input. Vincent SELECT `mdl_question`.`id` AS `id`, AVG(`Mdl Question Attempt Steps`.`fraction`) AS `avg` FROM `mdl_question` LEFT JOIN `mdl_question_versions` AS `Mdl Question Versions` ON `mdl_question`.`id` = `Mdl Question Versions`.`questionid` LEFT JOIN `mdl_question_bank_entries` AS `Mdl Question Bank Entries` ON `Mdl Question Versions`.`questionbankentryid` = `Mdl Question Bank Entries`.`id` LEFT JOIN `mdl_question_attempts` AS `Mdl Question Attempts` ON `mdl_question`.`id` = `Mdl Question Attempts`.`questionid` LEFT JOIN `mdl_question_attempt_steps` AS `Mdl Question Attempt Steps` ON `Mdl Question Attempts`.`id` = `Mdl Question Attempt Steps`.`questionattemptid` WHERE `Mdl Question Attempt Steps`.`fraction` IS NOT NULL

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: query for average fraction of all the questions in the question bank
ResponsesInList.Text:
In your query mdl_question_versions and mdl_question_bank_entries are joined but not used in the SELECT, WHERE, or GROUP BY clauses. Do you include them for a reason? Does this do what you want? `SELECT` `q.id AS id,` 
```text
 
    AVG(qas.fraction) AS avg
```
 
```text
FROM mdl_question
    q
```
 
```text
INNER JOIN mdl_question_attempts qa ON q.id =
    qa.questionid
```
 
```text
INNER JOIN mdl_question_attempt_steps qas ON
    qa.id = qas.questionattemptid
```
 
```text
WHERE qas.fraction IS NOT
    NULL
```
 `GROUP BY q.id` 
```text
ORDER BY q.id
    ASC;
```
 Or this: `SELECT` 
```text
  q.id AS
    id,
```
 `AVG(qas.fraction) AS avg` 
```text
FROM
    mdl_question q
```
 
```text
LEFT JOIN mdl_question_versions qv ON q.id =
    qv.questionid
```
 
```text
LEFT JOIN mdl_question_bank_entries qbe ON
    qv.questionbankentryid = qbe.id
```
 
```text
LEFT JOIN
    mdl_question_attempts qa ON q.id = qa.questionid
```
 
```text
LEFT JOIN
    mdl_question_attempt_steps qas ON qa.id =
    qas.questionattemptid
```
 
```text
WHERE qas.fraction IS NOT
    NULL
```
 `GROUP BY q.id` `ORDER BY q.id ASC;`

ResponsesInList.Title: Find questions in course categories
ResponsesInList.Text: Dear community, We have organised almost all of our questions directly into courses. The courses are organised in different categories and sub-(sub)-categories. However, there are very few questions that have been created in course categories due to incorrect permissions, which can be problematic in our case. Due to the large number of categories and courses, a manual search is very time-consuming. I have therefore thought about a DB query ( MariaDB ) via configrable reports plugin. However, my DB knowledge is not so good. Has anyone already carried out such a query and can post the SQL query here? Basically, I just need the ID of the course category in which the questions are located. There is a similar query: https://moodle.org/mod/forum/discuss.php?d=370896 , maybe that will help as a starting point. The context level would probably be 40 (course category context level), but as I said, my DB knowledge is not so good to find a useful result. many thanks best regards Anton

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Find questions in course categories
ResponsesInList.Text:
Assuming you are using Moodle 4.0 or later 
```text
SELECT *

FROM {question} q
JOIN {question_versions} qv ON qv.questionid = q.id
JOIN {question_bank_entries} qbe ON qbe.id = qv.questionbankentryid
JOIN {question_categories} qc ON qc.id = qbe.questioncategoryid
JOIN {context} ctx ON ctx.id = qc.contextid
JOIN {course_categories} cc ON cc.id = ctx.instanceid AND ctx.contextlevel = 40

WHERE ...
```

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Find questions in course categories
ResponsesInList.Text: Hi Tim, that's great, thank you very much. br, Anton

ResponsesInList.Title: excessive delay in obtaining the report
ResponsesInList.Text: hello. The report for 6,000 users takes too long to respond and if the same report is made with the adhoc queries plugin to the database it takes much less time. If a direct flat query is made to the database, it also responds instantly. What could be happening? moodle 4.2

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: excessive delay in obtaining the report
ResponsesInList.Text: Hi - We had similar issues. The simple fix is to get more RAM on the server for database operations - Configurable reports have a tendency to hit tipping point where intermediate steps in your query produce virtual tables that are too big to be held in RAM and the result is a sudden massive slowdown. Of course the better solution is to examine your query and work out what is the root cause. Most likely you are starting off joining tables together in a way that produces a huge number of virtual rows, much better to start with a limited table. EG don't join all users onto all course enrolments, start with course enrolments on the course you want and link users in later. If you are using phpmyadmin to run the query on the server directly then you can use "explain sql " to give you a clue where the problem is. Ken (not a database expert, but I have written a lot of configurable reports).

ResponsesInList.Title: Creating a Manager Report
ResponsesInList.Text: We have a course called Enterprise Study Program.  The course is designed to be accessed by A cohort of students (i.e., students from different companies) A manager role (i.e., manager or learning director at each of company), who will be able to access a participation report of people on their team (i.e., from their company) without being able to access the course materials My developer thinks this is not possible.  He said:  "There is no feature that forces a filtering by group in the reports." But I think what we are trying to do is so simple, it must be possible.  Maybe we need to make a copy of the course for each company? How would you advise we proceed

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Creating a Manager Report
ResponsesInList.Text: You should  also be able to achieve this in a single course by enrolling your managers into the course as a NonEditing Teacher (or any role), place them into same Groups as their cohort of students (you would need to first make these groups in the course) and then set the course Settings to force Separate Group Mode. This way, when they access reports or gradebook pages, they should only be able to see their own group of students. This also requires you to check that the role you place the managers in do not have the capability to "access all groups" - more info on the Moodle Doc's Groups page. ( FYI , Moodle Workplace also is perfect for this as it doesn't require you to enroll your Managers into courses with the students, you can make these connections as the site level.)

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Configurable reports Custom Variables
ResponsesInList.Text: Hi James, We've done something similar for two custom profile fields we have, "Tenant" and "Organisation" respectively. Below is a snippit that might help (we have a search fields setup to filter the results on a specific date range (for enrolment dates) and the "Organisation", if needed: SELECT DATE_FORMAT(CONVERT_TZ(FROM_UNIXTIME(ue.timecreated), 'UTC', 'Australia/Melbourne'), '%d-%m-%Y') AS EnrolDate, c.shortname, c.fullname, uidt.data as tenant, uido.data as Company, ue.timestart, u.firstname, u.lastname, u.username FROM prefix_enrol AS en JOIN prefix_course AS c ON c.id = en.courseid JOIN prefix_user_enrolments AS ue ON ue.enrolid = en.id JOIN prefix_user AS u ON u.id = ue.userid JOIN prefix_user_info_data AS uidt ON uidt.userid = u.id JOIN prefix_user_info_field AS uift on uift.id = uidt.fieldid and uift.shortname like '%Tenant%' JOIN prefix_user_info_data AS uido ON uido.userid = u.id JOIN prefix_user_info_field AS uifo on uifo.id = uido.fieldid and uifo.shortname like '%Organisation%' WHERE 1 %%FILTER_STARTTIME:ue.timecreated:>%% %%FILTER_ENDTIME:ue.timecreated:<%% %%FILTER_SEARCHTEXT_profile_organisation:uido.data:~%% AND uidt.data like '%PS%' ORDER BY EnrolDate, firstname, shortname We have joined the User_Info_Data and User_Info_Field tables twice because you need a separate instance for each custom profile field.

ResponsesInList.Title: Require feedback on this custom query
ResponsesInList.Text:
The purpose is to get the marks awarded to students for three activities namely pre, post and reflection from some specific courses. Went through the adhoc reports on the internet and customized a query to get the desired results. I would like your feedback on the below query, its correctness and any other feedback. 
```text
    SELECT u.firstname AS 'First' ,
    u.lastname AS 'Last',
    CONCAT(u.firstname, ' ', u.lastname) AS 'Display Name',
    c.fullname AS 'Course',
    cc.name AS 'Category',

    CASE
    WHEN gi.itemtype = 'course'
    THEN CONCAT(c.fullname, ' Course Total')
    ELSE gi.itemname
    END AS 'Item Name',

    ROUND(gg.finalgrade,2) AS Grade,
    DATE_FORMAT(FROM_UNIXTIME(gg.timemodified),'%Y-%m-%d') AS Time, g.name AS Groupname

    FROM prefix_course AS c
    JOIN prefix_context AS ctx ON c.id = ctx.instanceid
    JOIN prefix_role_assignments AS ra ON ra.contextid = ctx.id
    JOIN prefix_groups AS g ON g.courseid = c.id
    JOIN prefix_groups_members AS m ON g.id = m.groupid
    JOIN prefix_user AS u ON u.id = ra.userid AND m.userid = u.id
    JOIN prefix_grade_grades AS gg ON gg.userid = u.id
    JOIN prefix_grade_items AS gi ON gi.id = gg.itemid
    JOIN prefix_course_categories as cc ON cc.id = c.category
    WHERE gi.courseid = c.id AND (c.shortname = 'IDSPPH-CME-FM-22-FHS-MC-PK' OR c.shortname = 'NCD-CME-FM-22-FHS-MC-PK' OR c.shortname = 'RGC-CME-FM-22-FHS-MC-PK' OR c.shortname = 'PAC-CME-FM-22-FHS-MC-PK' OR c.shortname = 'BIN-CME-FM-22-FHS-MC-PK') AND (gi.itemname LIKE '%Pre%' OR gi.itemname LIKE '%Post%' OR gi.itemname LIKE '%Reflection%')
    ORDER BY u.firstname, c.fullname
```
 The sample result is like this: Grade Report with Items 'first' 'last' 'display name' 'Course' 'category' 'item name' 'Grade' 'Time' 'Groupname'

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Create a custom SQL query using the configurable reports

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Condition in relation to the user field of the report viewer, or how to see only students from a group without SQL code
ResponsesInList.Text: So... if you do it with SQL... You would put conditions like: WHERE c.id LIKE '%%COURSEID%%' -- (so that you would only get results from the course you are at that particular moment when you run the report) AND user.id LIKE '%%USERID%%' -- (where the user ID is the one of the person that is at that moment running the report - the instructor) And you would use these tables at least... prefix_course AS c JOIN prefix_groups AS g ON g.id = fd.groupid -- (I was getting information from forums, that is why I have fd.groupid but you might not need that table ) /*Now remove all the people who are not in the course anymore*/

ResponsesInList.Title: Using constants defined in the begining of the query?
ResponsesInList.Text: Hi, I use a lot the configurable reports block, with SQL queries. To allow an easier reading (and updating) of values used in queries, i'd like to be able te define constants at the begining of the report query, that could be used in the query. This would allow modifications, without needing to dig inside the queries, having all elements that could change defined at the beginning. This is possible in pure SQL (with lines like SET), but i've not found any possibility to do that, knowing that a single query is allowed (no ; possible). I see someone asked the same thing (nearly) one year ago, but had no answer. Does anybody have a solution for that? Séverin

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Using constants defined in the begining of the query?
ResponsesInList.Text:
Hi, For people reading french, you'd better look at the same discussion in french . I've found a solution, using CTE (Common Table Expression) ; this is available since MySql 8.0 (in 2018) or since MariaDB 10.2 (in 2017). You can look at MySQL's help page and MariaDB's help page . So, the application for my use is: at the begining of SQL, i add some lines to define my values at the begining of tables, i had my values table in my query, i use my values table An example, going from this : 
```text
SELECT
  cc.path,cc.name,c.fullname,FROM_UNIXTIME(c.startdate)

FROM prefix_course            AS c
JOIN prefix_course_categories AS cc   ON cc.id   = c.category

WHERE c.shortname LIKE '%law%'        -- To filter courses
  AND cc.path     LIKE "%/1055/1057%" -- To filter category
# AND cc.path     LIKE '%/1055%'      -- To filter category
```
 To this : 
```text
-- Define values to use in query (since 
MySql
 8.0 or 
MariaDB
 10.2)
WITH my AS ( SELECT
  '%law%'        AS Course -- To filter courses
 ,'%/1055/1057%' AS Cat    -- To filter category
#,'%/1055%'      AS Cat    -- To filter category (replace line upper)
)

-- Main query (no need to modify values)
SELECT
  cc.path,cc.name,c.fullname,FROM_UNIXTIME(c.startdate)

FROM my                       -- To be able to use my values
JOIN prefix_course            AS c
JOIN prefix_course_categories AS cc   ON cc.id   = c.category

WHERE c.shortname LIKE my.Course
  AND cc.path     LIKE my.Cat
```
 The main gain is to have personnalised values defined at the beginning of the query , and not inside it. Not visible with thie example, but with big long queries, it's more useful. Séverin

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Questionnaire Response across courses
ResponsesInList.Text: I don't use Questionnaire so I don't know its data structure. However, usually a third party plugin has a table with its own name which contains the instances of the plugin in the site and has several other tables which hold user information, files, activity etc. For example, the Feedback module has tables for each item (question) and for each value (response.) But each plugin does this differently. You will have to figure out what the various tables for Questionnaire each do. Perhaps someone here who does use Questionnaire can help you out with the details.

ResponsesInList.Title: Group Report
ResponsesInList.Text:
Hi there, I want a report which just shows users which are in the same group in a course as the user that is runnig the report. Is this possible? Or at least in the same global group? I've tried using this from another post 
```text
SELECT DISTINCT
course.fullname course,
CONCAT(user.firstname, ' ', user.lastname) AS 'Name',
user.email as 'Email',
user.city as 'City',
user.department as 'Department',
CASE
WHEN completions.timecompleted IS NOT NULL THEN ( FROM_UNIXTIME(completions.timecompleted, '%m-%d-%Y'))
ELSE '-Not Yet Completed-'
END AS 'Completion'



FROM prefix_course_completions AS completions
INNER JOIN prefix_course AS course ON completions.course = course.id AND course.visible = 1
INNER JOIN prefix_context AS cx ON course.id = cx.instanceid AND cx.contextlevel = '50'
INNER JOIN prefix_user AS user ON completions.userid = user.id AND user.deleted = 0 AND user.suspended = 0



INNER JOIN (SELECT vm.userid, vm.groupid, vg.id, vg.courseid, vg.name FROM prefix_groups_members AS vm
			INNER JOIN prefix_groups AS vg ON vg.id=vm.groupid
			INNER JOIN prefix_course AS c2 ON c2.id = vg.courseid
			WHERE vm.userid=%%USERID%%) AS groups ON groups.courseid = course.id



INNER JOIN prefix_groups_members AS members ON groups.id = members.groupid 
WHERE members.userid = user.id
%%FILTER_COURSES:course.id%% 
%%FILTER_USERS:user.department%%



ORDER BY course
```
 but it's not working. Anyone can help me?

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Group Report
ResponsesInList.Text: Yes, this is possible.

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Group Report
ResponsesInList.Text: Patrick, Basically you looking for one report to extract data about students, where you allow each student when he/she access this report to just see the data about his/her group no more. there is nothing straight a way such as a variable to be used to get you there. But I would like to share with you this example that has been shared by Randy in the ad-hoc contributed reports. If you reconstruct the tables after FROM to identify the group id first based on the userid for the student who explore the report, that would make it easier and you need to notice that in some stage probably you do not need to use the INNER JOIN. For example in Randy's syntax "FROM (SELECT groupid FROM prefix_groups_members WHERE userid = %%USERID%%) AS GRU" in this line we used the variable %%USERID%% to get the user who explore the report, but in this line of code "JOIN prefix_groups g ON g.id = GRU.groupid" we idintified the group id based on the userid that he/she explore the report. Then we joined the other tables that we need to use to get the data from in your case the completion and user tables. If you looking to get this report for the course that this report open in you need also to use the course variable " %%COURSEID%%". Here the list of all the variables and filters that you can use in Config reports block. I hope that's help in some how and thanks for sharing. Regards Mo
role: Picture of Motasem Al Haj Ali

ResponsesInList.Title: Course modules (sitewide) within specified period
ResponsesInList.Text:
Hi everyone, For a project I'm working on, I was wondering whether it would be possible to amend the following query, as to count the number of different course modules created/added between specified dates (e.g. between 1 Sept 2018 and 30 Aug 2019, etc.): 
```text
SELECT count( cm.id ) AS counter, m.name 


FROM    prefix_course_modules 


AS cm 


JOIN prefix_modules AS m ON cm.module = m.id GROUP BY cm.module 


ORDER BY counter DESC
```
 If so, how would I do that? I found the 'added' column in the course_modules table, so this should be possible.

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Course modules (sitewide) within specified period
ResponsesInList.Text: Joost, If using MySQL , try something like: WHERE (FROM_UNIXTIME(cm.added) BETWEEN '2018-09-01 00:00:00' AND '2019-08-31 00:00:00') for limiting date ranges. You can do this directly on the numbers too if you want to just use the time stamps and aren't worried about readability later on of the dates

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Course modules (sitewide) within specified period
ResponsesInList.Text: Joost and Randy, Also it is possible to add the date columns to your query and then add a filter which make the report as a tool, it can be used for any further query in future. If you are looking to compare that with previous years, I think you need to find a way to figure out the new modules from the old and imported modules. Best wishes Motasem
role: Picture of Motasem Al Haj Ali

ResponsesInList.Title: Help in tweaking SQL for a Report (Lost)
ResponsesInList.Text: Hi all I'm trying to create a custom report (using the Configurable reports block) and I've got a good lot working but I've hit a wall mentally on getting it to do some things and was hoping someone might be able to assist. I need help in doing the following: Display the Grade as a Letter (as set in Moodle) i.e Pass, Fail etc. rather than the numerical value Force the user to select which Month they want to run From Month to Month (so they have the option to either look at ALL of March or Jan to March as an example The date being displayed to be the date they were issued the grade i.e. I did an examination and my course total is populated, the date on the report should be that date the grade was issued. And how to make the report auto pickup the category I am in to run the report ONLY on that category (and thus anything below that point) - if not possible how to prompt the report user to select the category level they want, i.e. be it say Category 1 (and everything within/under) or Category 2 (and everything within and below and so on. What I have thus far: SELECT u.lastname AS "Lastname", u.firstname AS "Firstname", u.idnumber AS "SCC", c.fullname AS "Course", ROUND(gg.finalgrade,2) AS "Grade", DATE_FORMAT(FROM_UNIXTIME(gg.timemodified), '%d %M %Y') AS "Date" FROM prefix_course AS c JOIN prefix_context AS ctx ON c.id = ctx.instanceid JOIN prefix_role_assignments AS ra ON ra.contextid = ctx.id JOIN prefix_user AS u ON u.id = ra.userid JOIN prefix_grade_grades AS gg ON gg.userid = u.id JOIN prefix_grade_items AS gi ON gi.id = gg.itemid WHERE gi.courseid = c.id AND gi.itemtype = 'course' # students only role id is 5 AND ra.roleid = 5 ORDER BY Course, Lastname Jayden

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Help in tweaking SQL for a Report (Lost)
ResponsesInList.Text: If you are using the Moodle default Letters or have changed those in Site admin > Grades > Letters to your own values, you can use a basic CASE statement to show the letters, something like: CASE WHEN gg.finalgrade IS NULL THEN '' WHEN ROUND(gg.finalgrade,2)>=93.00 THEN 'A' WHEN ROUND(gg.finalgrade,2)>=90.00 THEN 'A-' # and so forth

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Help in tweaking SQL for a Report (Lost)
ResponsesInList.Text: Hi Randy Thank you so much. I've got the grade letters to appear. New problem, that I don't know if can be sorted or not: The numbers you have used in your post, I take these as a score... rather than a percentage. I tested this by adding a line for a grade that is technically Honors (in our system) with a dummy name and it now shows. Is there a way to make it use percentages rather than a score value, i.e. 100% = Distinction, 90 to 99 = Honors etc? Or is that now falling into the realm of the complex scenario you mentioned? Basically our system is (as set at the Site Admin level for ALL courses/exam activity results: 100 = Distinction 90-99 = Honours 70-89 = Pass 0-69 = no grade the just have to take it again. However, how each course is set is not consistent, i.e. some areas use grades out of 100, others use a set grade system, i.e. out of 20 (but it is not then scaled, its just out of 20). While Moodle can for the most part work out what 70, 90% of things are, I know some areas it doesn't or at least uses score over scale/percentage. The current coding is now: SELECT u.lastname AS "Lastname", u.firstname AS "Firstname", u.idnumber AS "SCC", c.fullname AS "Course", gg.finalgrade AS "Grade", DATE_FORMAT(FROM_UNIXTIME(gg.timemodified), '%d %M %Y') AS "Date Completed", CASE WHEN gg.finalgrade IS NULL THEN '' WHEN ROUND(gg.finalgrade,2)=100.00 THEN 'Distinction' WHEN ROUND(gg.finalgrade,2)>=90.00 THEN 'Honors' WHEN ROUND(gg.finalgrade,2)>=70.00 THEN 'Pass' WHEN ROUND(gg.finalgrade,2)>=19.00 THEN 'TEST' ELSE '-' END AS "Grade" FROM prefix_course AS c JOIN prefix_context AS ctx ON c.id = ctx.instanceid JOIN prefix_role_assignments AS ra ON ra.contextid = ctx.id JOIN prefix_user AS u ON u.id = ra.userid JOIN prefix_grade_grades AS gg ON gg.userid = u.id JOIN prefix_grade_items AS gi ON gi.id = gg.itemid WHERE gi.courseid = c.id AND gi.itemtype = 'course' # students only role id is 5 AND ra.roleid = 5 %%FILTER_STARTTIME:c.startdate:>%% %%FILTER_ENDTIME:c.enddate:<%% ORDER BY Course, Lastname Jayden

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Help in tweaking SQL for a Report (Lost)
ResponsesInList.Text: Moodle always stores the scores as they are (and always up to five decimal places: 00.00000). The percentages you see on the screen are done somewhere in the interface code to make them appear that way, with out without letters. It is calculated on the fly. That means if you want to percentages in your report, you have to do that math yourself in the report.

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Help in tweaking SQL for a Report (Lost)
ResponsesInList.Text: For item 4, you can use a filter to do that. It will provide a pull down menu to pick a category from. Take a look at this query by François that shows how to use both category and subcategory type filters .

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Help in tweaking SQL for a Report (Lost)
ResponsesInList.Text: Hi again Randy I've tried doing this and the link (thank you for that), its not filtering correctly. For example, at one point it was giving me an April date despite filter on March. However on further looking and thinking, I think that's because i'm looking for a date based on when a quiz etc is passed and the thus that date when the grade is issued in the system, which I don't think can be that fine tuned on the report. JT

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Help in tweaking SQL for a Report (Lost)
ResponsesInList.Text: It will filter based on whatever table and column you tell it to. The code above is filtering on the course start and end dates for the whole course, which have nothing to do with when the grades or quiz are done. %%FILTER_STARTTIME:c.startdate:>%% %%FILTER_ENDTIME:c.enddate:<%% So you need to put here the dates of what you are filtering on.

ResponsesInList.Title: Missing rows in Report
ResponsesInList.Text: Hi, We're using a Report to collate and display to our tutors a list of Assignments awaiting grading, which is mostly working well (thanks to expert help from this forum), but we're seeing some odd behaviour whereby there are some Assignment submissions that aren't showing up in the report until the Assignment submission has been visited. The row for the submission then shows up on the next page refresh. We're also pulling Submissions and Grades into our central SRS via Web Services, and the submissions are coming in via that route, leading me to wonder if some fields relating to Grades/Assignment Submissions only populate once they've been viewed by a user with grading permissions? I doubt it, but I'm at a loss as to why the query misses some records. The query is: ```text SELECT DISTINCT ``` ```text g.name AS "Group", ``` ```text u.firstname AS "First", ``` ```text u.lastname AS "Last", ``` ```text c.fullname AS "Course", ``` ```text a.name AS "Assignment", ``` ```text sub.status AS "Status", ``` ```text DATE_FORMAT(FROM_UNIXTIME(sub.timemodified), '%d/%m/%Y (%H:%i)') AS "When", ``` ```text cm.module, ``` ```text concat('Provide Feedback (Filterable View)  | Provide Feedback (Simplified View)') ``` ```text AS "Feedback Status" ``` ```text FROM prefix_assign_submission sub ``` ```text JOIN prefix_assign a ON a.id = sub.assignment AND a.name NOT LIKE '%Summative%' ``` ```text JOIN prefix_user u ON u.id = sub.userid ``` ```text JOIN prefix_course c ON c.id = a.course ``` ```text JOIN prefix_groups g ON g.courseid=c.id ``` ```text JOIN prefix_groups_members gm ON u.id=gm.userid and gm.groupid=g.id ``` ```text JOIN prefix_course_modules cm ON c.id = cm.course ``` ```text JOIN prefix_modules m ON m.id=cm.module ``` ```text JOIN prefix_context cxt ON c.id=cxt.instanceid AND cxt.contextlevel=50 ``` ```text JOIN prefix_role_assignments ra ON cxt.id = ra.contextid AND ra.roleid=5 AND ra.userid=u.id ``` ```text JOIN prefix_assign_grades ag ON sub.userid = ag.userid AND sub.assignment = ag.assignment ``` ```text ``` ```text WHERE cm.instance = a.id AND cm.module = 1 AND sub.status != "new" AND g.name NOT LIKE 'BA%' AND ag.grade < 1.0 AND ``` ```text LOWER(g.name) LIKE LOWER((CONCAT ('%', ``` ```text ( ``` ```text     SELECT CONCAT(firstname,lastname) ``` ```text     FROM prefix_user usr ``` ```text     WHERE usr.id = %%USERID%% ``` ```text ), '%'))) ``` ```text ORDER BY c.fullname, a.name, u.lastname ``` Many thanks for any pointers. All the best, Paul

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Missing rows in Report
ResponsesInList.Text: Paul I would look at a couple of things: - You are doing an inner join on assign_grades but there can be submission not yet graded. I would experiment with an outer join of some sort, left join probably, to see if those get included when submitted and not yet graded.

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Missing rows in Report
ResponsesInList.Text: Thanks Randy, I'll try what you suggest and get back to you with the results. All the best Paul

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Missing rows in Report
ResponsesInList.Text: Hi Randy, Just to update; using a Left join on the context and assign_grades tables made the difference. There was also the ag.grade < 1.0 condition which excluded the same missing items  - the starting grade of 1.0 or -1.0 sometimes only gets recorded to the assign_grades table once the submission grading page is visited, for a reason I haven't yet fathomed, which confused things a little. Many thanks for your help with this! 👍

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Missing rows in Report
ResponsesInList.Text: Paul, Nice: Left Join for the win. Also, I hear you about the assign_grades table: I have yet to fully figure out when it puts entries in there. It seems inconsistent, especially if you start looking at the time stamps for those. I suspect cron is involved, but I am not sure. I have seen rows in that table with no grader (-1) or grade (also -1) with no real submissions at all yet but sometimes no rows at all until a submission has been actually graded. It's a mystery I haven't fully looked into yet.

ResponsesInList.Title: MWP - Ability to specify emails rather than users
ResponsesInList.Text: Hello! In the single Moodle instances, you can specify emails rather than being forced to select users to email reports to. In Moodle Workplace, however, it forces you to select users/cohorts belonging to that specific tenant. Even in the Ad Hoc report settings, it still forces you to select users or cohorts of a certain tenant. Is there a way to input a list of emails rather than specifying users? Moodle Workplace 3.11.4 (Build: 20211125) Moodle 3.11.4 (Build: 20211108)

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: MWP - Ability to specify emails rather than users
ResponsesInList.Text: This is the way it has always worked, you can only choose from the usernames available to you (which in WP means per tenant). Have you checked the plugin issues to see if there is a request to be able to use arbitrary email addresses? https://github.com/moodleou/moodle-report_customsql/issues

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: MWP - Ability to specify emails rather than users
ResponsesInList.Text: Here are the ways I found and am inquirin about better options in regards to sending emails non-moodle users or for a user that needs to be in multiple tenant(such as sale and HR reps) Option 1 : Sent to one email and forward Pick a designated user to receive the email Setup an email rule to forward that email to the desired recipients Yahoo(Need Yahoo Pro) | Gmail(use filters) | Outlook | Thunderbird(Use filters) Option 2 : Create multiple accounts In Moodle create an account for each Tenant using a unique email Email options include email alias or personal/alternate company emails Gmail Alias (+TenantName) | Yahoo Alias | Outlook alias The main issue with aliases hat need to be made is getting the users to create them Option 3 : Changing users Tenant as needed Changing the users tenant can only be done using the Upload users CSV upload and just changing the tenant field, nothing else Site administration > Users > Upload users Inquiry 1 : Use Ad-hoc database queries to send to email ? Site administration > Reports > Ad-hoc database queries Is this possible, where can I find documentation? Inquiry 2 : Plugin Option? Plugin made for allowing emails to be specified instead of forcing users to be selected Is there a plugin for this? I have been searching for weeks and have had no luck Inquiry 3 : Base Code editing Edit the base code to enable emails to be typed rather than forcing a selection Is it possible to eit the base coding to allow this? If so how do I go about doing that? Moodle Reported issues/feature request: email report to non-moodle users? https://github.com/moodleou/moodle-report_customsql/issues/25 emailing a real user is easier with the Moodle APIs. It's not that hard to create a user with auth type 'nologin' and the email address you want.

ResponsesInList.Title: Create a report for the whole of system (all courses)
ResponsesInList.Text: I have not been able to find this question being answered previously... I am looking to create a report that shows activities that require grading across the whole school - all courses. What is the structure to query each course in turn, or is there a simple way to check all submissions across the site awaiting grading? I appreciate any help you can provide.

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Create a report for the whole of system (all courses)
ResponsesInList.Text: You can check the queries on the Ad-hoc contributed queries page that may help you. For example, this query shows all Assignments waiting to be graded . There are a number of queries there relating to Quizzes as well. To get ALL activities waiting to be graded, you have to go through each type of activity separately since each activity that can be graded has a completely different way of storing that data. Assignments and Quizzes and Forums all do it in a different way. So, you really have to have three (or more) reports and put them together to get total coverage.

ResponsesInList.Title: Length limit - concat and group_concat
ResponsesInList.Text: Hello, I would like to create a query: From each teacher I want to show all his courses with the urls of the courses. If I query  the course name or ID for the courses, there is a difference of the result. As soon as I use Group_Concat or concat not all courses are displayed. Are there any restrictions on the number of characters here? SELECT concat (u.firstname, " ", u.lastname) as trainer, GROUP_CONCAT(c.fullname, ' </br>') as course,  # incomplete list of courses GROUP_CONCAT(c.id, ' </br>') as course2,      # complete list of course-ids u.auth FROM prefix_course AS c JOIN prefix_context AS ctx ON c.id = ctx.instanceid JOIN prefix_role_assignments AS ra ON ra.contextid = ctx.id and ra.roleid= 3 JOIN prefix_user AS u ON u.id = ra.userid Group BY u.id

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Length limit - concat and group_concat
ResponsesInList.Text: Yes, there is a restriction. The default length is 1024. Official documentation and how to up that are here: https://dev.mysql.com/doc/refman/8.0/en/aggregate-functions.html#function_group-concat as well as some other ways of doing it in the accepted answer to this post: https://stackoverflow.com/questions/12001919/mysql-truncates-concatenated-result-of-a-group-concat-function

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Length limit - concat and group_concat
ResponsesInList.Text: Thanks for the quick reply and the helpful links!

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Length limit - concat and group_concat
ResponsesInList.Text: No worries. I ran into this exact issue myself about a year ago and the solution was to up the number in the mysql .ini file.

ResponsesInList.Title: Activity completion including COHORT
ResponsesInList.Text: Hi all, I work for a small private hospital that has approx. 750 staff. I've inherited a set up which seems to have been delivered based on splitting all the nursing staff into various cohorts. These cohorts don't tend to change each year etc. - they're a proxy for department names I need to be able to deliver reporting that shows activity completion for our ORG WIDE compliance learnings. The department field has not been used consistently so I can't filter by this. What would be the SQL code I could dump into our system that would give me the same data as a standard activity report but INCLUDING the cohort field. ideally, the report would separate each cohort into a different tab on a workbook, but failing that, I can run some vba across the report.

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Activity completion including COHORT
ResponsesInList.Text: You can take a look at the Cohorts queries on the Ad-hoc contributed reports page . All the logic you need to do that should be there.

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Activity completion including COHORT
ResponsesInList.Text: Hey Randy, Thanks for your reply. I'm new to all this, however, I have viewed these pages previously - the challenge I have is that I don't know how to successfully "chain" pieces of SQL code together. in my really junior kind of way, I've picked two reports and tried to combine them - and this is not working. If I was to find an Activity Completion report, and add this piece of SQL to it, should it work?

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Activity completion including COHORT
ResponsesInList.Text: I would suggest that you step back and first do something basic then. - Get a handle on the basics of query syntax from some of the learning sites, like https://www.w3schools.com/mysql/ and https://www.mysqltutorial.org/ . You only need to be sure of the basics first (like how SELECT, JOIN, and WHERE work) to do about many if not most of the queries on that page. - Start with a basic query and add to it: even experienced users do it this way rather than try to cram two complex queries together. As John Gall says, "All complex systems that work can be shown to come from simpler systems that work." - Study some queries that are similar to what you need if not exact and get those running first: do those above queries on completion and the ones on groups run and work on your site? If not, then combining won't either.

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Activity completion including COHORT
ResponsesInList.Text: Have you thought about using the Cohort info to UPDATE the Department field? This might simplify reporting on the Department field. I am not a master at SQL, but I have some experience.  Randy's method of digging in is a good one.  I've found most of Moodle's standard reports are highly complex and like you say, include more than necessary.  Do you have access to the database ?  I don't, so I use the plugin Adminer to view what all the tables look like and what data to expect.  Helps me understand what initially looks like a big mess, lol. Understanding all these Adhoq queries and why they are built the way they are is key as well.  Otherwise you'll never know what can be cut out.  Each site and need is often quite different.

ResponsesInList.Title: Adding Feedback Files to an Assignment Grades report
ResponsesInList.Text: Hi, I'm hoping someone with better SQL skills than I can help me with this (previoulsy posted this to the dev community - I forgot there's this specific CR forum!) We're wanting to download the Feedback File a tutor provides for a student for each assignment into our central SIS or at least for now just make it available via Configurable reports, but I'm struggling to create a relationship between the tutor's feedback file and the grade item for the student which the file was uploaded for. It's complicated a little by us having multiple tutors within each course with their own private student groups, so not all feedback in a course belongs to one tutor, although I'm hoping there's a way of matching a feedback file against the tutor who uploaded it/graded the student. We have a separate report that lists links to a student's assignment submission (which contains the report file) against the marking tutor, but we need to be bringing the report files into the same report as the grades. Many thanks, Paul

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Adding Feedback Files to an Assignment Grades report
ResponsesInList.Text: Just to update, this is the query I have to-date: ```text SELECT ag.userid, ag.grader, u.username AS 'Graded by', ag.id AS "ag.id", ag.assignment AS "ag.assignment", f.itemid, f.contextid AS 'f.contextid', ctx.instanceid AS "ctx.instanceid", concat('',f.filename,'')  AS "Feedback File", DATE_FORMAT(FROM_UNIXTIME(f.timecreated),'%Y-%m-%d %H:%i') AS "Created" FROM prefix_files f JOIN prefix_user u ON u.id = f.userid JOIN prefix_context ctx ON f.contextid = ctx.id JOIN prefix_assign a ON ctx.instanceid = a.id JOIN prefix_assign_grades ag ON a.id = ag.assignment AND ag.grader = f.userid WHERE f.component = 'assignfeedback_file' AND  f.filearea = 'feedback_files' AND  f.filesize > 0 ORDER BY u.username, f.filename ``` So although I have the feedback file(s) associated with the grader, I'm yet to work out how to associate the feedback file with the grade or assignment submission. The tables I've checked so far have yielded no common fields between these two halves of the problem.  Hoping somebody can help with this? Many thanks, Paul

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Adding Feedback Files to an Assignment Grades report
ResponsesInList.Text: When the .component in the _files table is of type 'assignfeedback_file' then the .itemid there is the id of the grade in the _assign_grades table. The feedback file and the grade go together. Or f.itemid = ag.id WHERE f.component = 'assignfeedback_file'.

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Adding Feedback Files to an Assignment Grades report
ResponsesInList.Text: Many thanks Randy! Looking back I'd already tried that but had another Join interfering with the results, you've saved me a lot of time there!

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Adding Feedback Files to an Assignment Grades report
ResponsesInList.Text: Most welcome, Paul.

ResponsesInList.Title: Survey results - SQL syntax error for MariaDB for setting limit offset
ResponsesInList.Text:
```text

```
 Hi everyone, this query works to get survey module results massively. You can use it! 😀

But there is a little problem with the syntax when trying to set a specific limit:

- I already have set max 20,000 rows in the plugin configuration: block_configurable_reports | reportlimit.
- As the result is bigger than 20,000, I want to set a row limit setting a offset, everytime until get all the information I want
- (LIMIT 0, 20,000)
- (LIMIT 20,000, 40,000)
- (LIMIT 40,000, 80,000)

- But the plugin send me this error message: "You have an error in your SQL syntax; check the manual that corresponds to your MariaDB server version for the right syntax to use near 'LIMIT 0, 20000' at line 41"

Please, help! Is this a plugin limitation, because there is already set a limit by default by report limit parameter?
Is there another option?

This is the query:
-----
select distinct
f.name as 'Encuesta',
c.fullname as 'Curso',
c.shortname as 'Nombre Corto de Curso',
c.id as 'Curso ID',
(
select concat(d.firstname, ' ', d.lastname)
from prefix_role_assignments mra
inner join prefix_user d on mra.userid = d.id
inner join prefix_context context on mra.contextid = context.id
where
context.instanceid = c.id and
mra.roleid in (select id from prefix_role where shortname like '%teacher%')
GROUP BY d.id
limit 1
) as 'Docente',
(
select d.idnumber
from prefix_role_assignments mra
inner join prefix_user d on mra.userid = d.id
inner join prefix_context context on mra.contextid = context.id
where
context.instanceid = c.id and
mra.roleid in (select id from prefix_role where shortname like '%teacher%')
GROUP BY d.id
limit 1
) as 'Docente ID',
concat(u.firstname, ' ', u.lastname) as 'Usuario',
u.idnumber as 'Usuario ID',
date_format(from_unixtime(fc.timemodified), '%e %b %Y %H:%i:%s') as 'Fecha y Hora de Respuesta',
fi.name as 'Pregunta',
fv.value as 'Respuesta'
from prefix_feedback_completed fc
inner join prefix_feedback f on fc.feedback = f.id
inner join prefix_course c on f.course = c.id
inner join prefix_user u on fc.userid = u.id
inner join prefix_feedback_item fi on f.id = fi.feedback
inner join prefix_feedback_value fv on fi.id = fv.item and fv.completed = fc.id
where f.name = 'Encuesta sobre desempeño docente'
order by c.id
limit 0, 20000
----

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Survey results - SQL syntax error for MariaDB for setting limit offset
ResponsesInList.Text: Hi, If i'm not wrong, the plugin enforces the limit, so you can't specify one in your query. It could be cool to have a way to specify a limit in the query (ticking a checkbox, or automatically if a LIMIT line is in the query), but the enforced limit is here to avoid problems with too much results (and having a way to specify another limit could break this protection). Séverin

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Survey results - SQL syntax error for MariaDB for setting limit offset
ResponsesInList.Text: Hi Mr. Terrier: It looks like you said. Thank you for your time. Its very kind of you.

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Moodle 3.11 Compatibility?
ResponsesInList.Text: A 500 server error could mean many things, like the results of a query are huge, or there are caching issues, or server configuration, or internal network issues, or database connection issues, or a myriad of other things. It's a generic error from Apache (or whatever web server). Config Reports does not set any cookie. The only cookie it needs is the standard Moodle session cookie. Can you run a simple one line report like SELECT * FROM prefix_user WHERE id = 2 ? If so, it's something to do with timing or performance or the query, as Emma suggests. But no reports at all, even the simplest, can run, then it is something else. If it was working before and now it is not, something changed. That's not so helpful, I know, but if it was working and now it is not.... something somewhere is different.

ResponsesInList.Title: Query no limit for run Store Procedure
ResponsesInList.Text: Hi ! I am using Moodle 3.4 and Configurable Reports 3.1.1 I need to run a Store Procedure. But Configurable reports adds at the end "limit 5000", so it doesnt work with that limit.... Do you know how i can avoid that limit?
role: Picture of Luis Guillermo Loaiza Cordero

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Query no limit for run Store Procedure
ResponsesInList.Text: Be very careful with this - Site administration>Plugins>reports Ad-hoc database queries.

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Query no limit for run Store Procedure
ResponsesInList.Text: If you mean you need to increase the limit, you can do that in Site admin > Plugins > Blocks > Configurable reports > Report row limit. The default is 5,000. You can increase (or decrease) that to what you need. This is a global setting that affects all reports, so if you do have a lot of large reports users are running, it could slow things down. If you mean you need to remove the appending of the LIMIT parameter for the stored procedure to work when the plugin code builds the SQL query, then you would need to edit the code for the plugin where that limit is appended. Take a look in the block's directory /reports/sql/report_class.php to do that.

ResponsesInList.Title: Only need Failed Results
ResponsesInList.Text: Hello Query Experts, I have a working query, that was heavily borrowed from a Moodle expert. The results look like this, with passing and failed results - but I need to limit the results to just Failed values. How do I modify this query, to only receive a status of failed? SELECT prefix_user.firstname, prefix_user.lastname, prefix_user.email, prefix_grade_items.gradepass AS pointstopass, ROUND(prefix_grade_grades.finalgrade, 0) AS pointsobtained, ROUND(prefix_grade_grades.finalgrade / prefix_grade_items.grademax * 100, 0) AS finalgradepercent, (CASE WHEN ROUND(prefix_grade_grades.finalgrade, 0) >= prefix_grade_items.gradepass THEN 'Passed' ELSE 'Failed' END) AS Status, prefix_course.fullname AS course FROM prefix_grade_grades INNER JOIN prefix_grade_items ON prefix_grade_grades.itemid = prefix_grade_items.id INNER JOIN prefix_course ON prefix_grade_items.courseid = prefix_course.id

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Only need Failed Results
ResponsesInList.Text: Does adding this next line to where conditions work for you? AND ROUND(prefix_grade_grades.finalgrade, 0) < prefix_grade_items.gradepass Full query: SELECT prefix_user.firstname, prefix_user.lastname, prefix_user.email, prefix_grade_items.gradepass AS pointstopass, ROUND(prefix_grade_grades.finalgrade, 0) AS pointsobtained, ROUND(prefix_grade_grades.finalgrade / prefix_grade_items.grademax * 100, 0) AS finalgradepercent, (CASE WHEN ROUND(prefix_grade_grades.finalgrade, 0) >= prefix_grade_items.gradepass THEN 'Passed' ELSE 'Failed' END) AS Status, prefix_course.fullname AS course FROM prefix_grade_grades INNER JOIN prefix_grade_items ON prefix_grade_grades.itemid = prefix_grade_items.id INNER JOIN prefix_course ON prefix_grade_items.courseid = prefix_course.id INNER JOIN prefix_course_categories ON prefix_course.category = prefix_course_categories.id INNER JOIN prefix_user ON prefix_grade_grades.userid = prefix_user.id WHERE (prefix_grade_items.itemname IS NOT NULL) AND (prefix_grade_items.itemmodule = 'quiz' OR prefix_grade_items.itemmodule IS NULL) AND (prefix_grade_grades.timemodified IS NOT NULL) AND prefix_user.deleted = 0 AND prefix_user.suspended = 0 and (prefix_course.visible = 1) AND ROUND(prefix_grade_grades.finalgrade, 0) < prefix_grade_items.gradepass %%FILTER_COURSEENROLLEDSTUDENTS%%

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Only need Failed Results
ResponsesInList.Text: Perfect! Thank you! It makes perfect sense, now that I see it.

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Export report sql to xml
ResponsesInList.Text: Marco, That is correct. This xml file is an export of the report itself. Its purpose is for safekeeping a copy of the report as a file and/or to be able to share it or copy it to another Moodle installation. It does not contain any data. If you want the data provided by a particular report, you need to use one of the Export options on the Report menu, which are csv, json, ods or excel.

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Ri: Re: Export report sql to xml
ResponsesInList.Text: If you output the data as csv, I believe you can probably find a site on the web that will do the conversion for you from csv to xml. I have not done this in a long time, so I can't recommend any site in particular. I think also the Excel can export sheets to xml format for you. I don't use MS products, so perhaps someone else knows how to do that. For ods formats for LibreOffice, OpenOffice, there's a plugin exporter to do this: http://digitalimprint.com/misc/oooexport/

ResponsesInList.Title: Find private files of each user: alias/shortcuts to courses
ResponsesInList.Text: Dear Community, we have some users who use "private files" in Moodle. Some of the files are placed in courses via alias/shortcut, some others as a copy. If users open their private files repository and click on a file they can see, in which courses the files are linked as alias/shortcut. As Moodle Admin I wan't to know which user has private files and in which courses the linked files are placed: list of all users (ID, Firstname, Lastname) who uses private files list of private files (filename, filepath in private file folder, filesize) list of courses (ID, shortname, lastname) where these files are linked as alias/shortcut PS: we have a database query which finds all private files of a user ```text Select u.firstname, u.lastname, u.username, ``` ```text concat('',u.id,'') as 'ID and link to user profile', ``` ```text DATE_FORMAT(FROM_UNIXTIME(u.lastlogin), '%e %b %Y') AS 'lastlogin', u.suspended AS 'active (0) or suspended (1) User', f.filename, f.filesize ``` ```text from prefix_files AS f ``` ```text JOIN prefix_user AS u ON u.id = f.userid ``` ```text where filearea = "private" ``` Mayb it es easy to customise this query, but I don't know how to find out the courses and files which are placed via alias/shortcut. Any ideas? thanks, br Anton

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Find private files of each user: alias/shortcuts to courses
ResponsesInList.Text: Anton,

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Find private files of each user: alias/shortcuts to courses
ResponsesInList.Text: Dear Randy, thanks for your help. It concerns several tables: context , course_modules, user, course, files - so It was not easy to get the whole information, but following query will show me the correct information I want - maybe it's interesting for others: ```text select f.contextid, f.component, f.filearea, f.filename, concat('',f.userid,'') as 'ID and Link to Userprofile', u.firstname, u.lastname, f.filesize, f.mimetype, f.source, f.author, f.referencefileid, c.instanceid as 'ID from prefix_context', cm.id as 'ID from prefix_course_modules', concat('',cm.course,'') as kursid_and_link, co.fullname, co.shortname from prefix_files as f JOIN prefix_context AS c ON c.id = f.contextid JOIN prefix_course_modules as cm ON cm.id = c.instanceid JOIN prefix_user as u ON u.id = f.userid JOIN prefix_course as co ON co.id = cm.course where referencefileid != "" ``` thanks, br Anton

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Find private files of each user: alias/shortcuts to courses
ResponsesInList.Text: Anton, Oh, this is very nice! The only small change I would make is to use WHERE referencfileid IS NOT NULL instead of checking for an empty value. I notice in the column that all those are null for normal files. Would you consider sharing this over on the Ad-hoc contributed reports page? https://docs.moodle.org/310/en/ad-hoc_contributed_reports Randy

ResponsesInList.Title: Help with adding a cohort filter
ResponsesInList.Text: Hi, A little new to configurable reports, and Im no sql expert. Thats only two strikes. Ive been creating many reports since I recently installed the plugin and using some of the many sql examples from moodle docs page. Now I want to add a cohort filter to many of my reports. I found documentation on how to do that, although Im still working on that... Anyways I also found this previous post here that appears to have the answer, but not the actual sql that solved the problem, and I cant figure out  how to incorporate the logic and where clause with this sql. In other words, the sql in that post worked for me (see below), but when talking about working in the logic for cohorts and adding a where clause is not working for me. Can anyone suggest the edit (and/or any additional steps needed) for this sql to add a cohort filter? SELECT DISTINCT u.lastname as "Last Name", u.firstname as "First Name", concat('',c.fullname,'') AS Course, case when ccom.timecompleted IS NULL then concat('', 'Not Complete','') when ccom.timecompleted IS NOT NULL then 'Completed' end as "Completion Status" FROM {user} AS u JOIN {course_completions} AS ccom ON u.id = ccom.userid JOIN {course} AS c ON c.id = ccom.course ORDER BY u.lastname, u.firstname,c.fullname

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Help with adding a cohort filter
ResponsesInList.Text: I'm not sure about the configurable reports part of it -- cohorts isn't one of the filters specfied in the documentation, but if you're able to enter the cohort name or id, the sql to select the above, but filtered on cohorts would be SELECT DISTINCT u.lastname as "Last Name", u.firstname as "First Name", concat(' ',c.fullname,' ') AS Course, case when ccom.timecompleted IS NULL then concat(' ', 'Not Complete',' ') when ccom.timecompleted IS NOT NULL then 'Completed' end as "Completion Status" FROM {user} AS u JOIN {course_completions} AS ccom ON u.id = ccom.userid JOIN {course} AS c ON c.id = ccom.course join {cohort_members} cm on cm.userid=u.id join {cohort} co on co.id=cm.cohortid ORDER BY u.lastname, u.firstname,c.fullname if you want to filter on cohort name then it would be where co.name= ... Note that in this case cohort membership is treated independently of the course; if you're using cohort enrolments, then you may want to factor that in, so for a cohort you only see the list of people and courses relevant to that cohort., rather than all courses for people in a particular cohort.

ResponsesInList.Title: Summary Query - I am stymied by two issues.
ResponsesInList.Text: I have cobbled together a summary query to help me quickly look for students that need some encouragement to complete their assigned courses. I am stymied by two issues. 1. My Sum statement does not product an error, but it also does not produce any results. My workaround is to export to Excel and do the math there, but I would like to learn how to correctly create a SUM statement. 2. My SQL Query is off-here and there because when an active employee is moved to a new job position their cohort membership is removed. The filter current enrolments is not reading the adjusted cohort membership. The course participation's enrollments are correct, but my SQL Queries are always a little overstated here and there. Is there a way I can correct the issues I am having with this query? SELECT DISTINCT CONCAT(u.firstname, ' ', u.lastname) AS Name, COUNT(p.timeenrolled) as 'Assigned', COUNT(p.timecompleted) AS 'TotalCompletions', SUM(('TotalCompletions' / 'Assigned' )*100) As PercentComplete FROM prefix_course_completions AS p JOIN prefix_course AS c ON p.course = c.id AND c.visible = 1 JOIN prefix_user AS u ON p.userid = u.id AND u.deleted = 0 AND u.suspended = 0 %%FILTER_COURSES:id%% %%FILTER_COURSEENROLLEDSTUDENTS%% GROUP BY p.userid ORDER BY Name Kind Regards

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Summary Query - I am stymied by two issues.
ResponsesInList.Text: Shirley, For the SUM just use the actual columns in the calculation: p.timecompleted / p.timeenrolled. For the cohorts, is the user being re-enrolled again in the same course via another cohort? That is, unenrolled and then re-enrolled? And if so, then the user is probably taken out of this course completion table on unenroll and being added back again on the new enrol with its new dates.

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Summary Query - I am stymied by two issues.

Some are assigned new cohorts and courses. The employee moved to another department and/or supervisory role. I evaluated that 46% of my query is spot-on! The remainder has job changes, or course revisions and or the course audience changed since the start date of the course.

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Summary Query - I am stymied by two issues.

ResponsesInList.Title: SQL help needed to incorporate filter into query
ResponsesInList.Text: I'm using this report as my starting point: ( https://docs.moodle.org/310/en/ad-hoc_contributed_reports#Site-Wide_Grade_Report_with_All_Items ), and the query works, but the filter I added in Moodle had no effect on the report.  From another forum, I learned that I need to edit the code to incorporate the filter into the query for it to have any effect.  I tried checking the documentation for this plugin to figure out what I need to add to the SQL code. I added these lines: WHERE 1=1 %%FILTER_SEARCHTEXT:u.username%% in the code below, but can't seem to get the syntax right.  Moodle keeps telling me that I have an error and need to check the manual that corresponds to my version of MariaDB , but I'm not sure where to find what to find my version information.  How do I find this information, and what am I doing wrong? SELECT u.firstname AS 'First' , u.lastname AS 'Last', CONCAT(u.firstname,' ',u.lastname) AS 'Display Name', u.username AS 'Username', c.fullname AS 'Course', CASE WHEN gi.itemtype = 'course' THEN ' Course Total' ELSE gi.itemname

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: SQL help needed to incorporate filter into query
ResponsesInList.Text: The FROM clause must immediately follow the SELECT clause, and it it must be immediately followed by the WHERE clause. You have two WHERE clauses, one stuck in the middle in the wrong place, and you can only have one, after the FROM. See: https://www.tutorialspoint.com/mysql/mysql-select-query.htm . You need to move the filter from the first WHERE clause to the second WHERE clause to create one single clause.

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: SQL help needed to incorporate filter into query
ResponsesInList.Text: I missed the second WHERE clause. Thanks! This is the original report I got from the ad hoc page, and it works, even though the FROM clause is separated from the SELECT clause,so I guess I'm confused: SELECT u.firstname AS 'First' , u.lastname AS 'Last', u.firstname + ' ' + u.lastname AS 'Display Name', c.fullname AS 'Course', cc.name AS 'Category', CASE WHEN gi.itemtype = 'course' THEN c.fullname + ' Course Total' ELSE gi.itemname END AS 'Item Name', ROUND(gg.finalgrade,2) AS Grade, DATEADD(ss,gg.timemodified,'1970-01-01') AS TIME FROM prefix_course AS c JOIN prefix_context AS ctx ON c.id = ctx.instanceid JOIN prefix_role_assignments AS ra ON ra.contextid = ctx.id JOIN prefix_user AS u ON u.id = ra.userid JOIN prefix_grade_grades AS gg ON gg.userid = u.id JOIN prefix_grade_items AS gi ON gi.id = gg.itemid JOIN prefix_course_categories AS cc ON cc.id = c.category WHERE gi.courseid = c.id ORDER BY lastname Here is the code as I've edited it. It's mostly the same, but I cannot get Moodle to execute the filter: SELECT u.firstname AS 'First' , u.lastname AS 'Last', CONCAT(u.firstname,' ',u.lastname) AS 'Display Name', u.username AS 'Username', c.fullname AS 'Course', CASE WHEN gi.itemtype = 'course' THEN ' Course Total' ELSE gi.itemname END AS 'Item Name', ROUND(gg.finalgrade,2) AS Grade, FROM_UNIXTIME(gg.timemodified) AS Time FROM prefix_course AS c JOIN prefix_context AS ctx ON c.id = ctx.instanceid JOIN prefix_role_assignments AS ra ON ra.contextid = ctx.id JOIN prefix_user AS u ON u.id = ra.userid JOIN prefix_grade_grades AS gg ON gg.userid = u.id JOIN prefix_grade_items AS gi ON gi.id = gg.itemid JOIN prefix_course_categories AS cc ON cc.id = c.category WHERE gi.courseid = c.id %%FILTER_SEARCHTEXT:u.username%% ORDER BY lastname

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: SQL help needed to incorporate filter into query
ResponsesInList.Text: Stephanie, Try this for your filter: %%FILTER_SEARCHTEXT:u.username:~%% There's a squiggly ~ at the end before the second %% - this is the indicator to the filter what to do. Also, your ORDER BY should have a u.lastname with the u. alias, otherwise it won't know what table you mean.

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: SQL help needed to incorporate filter into query
ResponsesInList.Text: Randy, Thanks. I tried what you suggested, but Moodle's still ignoring the filter. Stephanie

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Configurable Reports by User Group
ResponsesInList.Text:
Hi Richard, I recently needed the ability to limit reports to only show members that were in the same group as the user running the report and came across your post. Using the suggestion from Emma, I created the following SQL report. In my case I was just looking for course completion, but it shouldn't be too hard to change this to pulling grades instead. I also made use of the Configurable Reports Filter capability. Hope the following helps you get what you need. I don't know how optimized my approach is, but I am working with just a small set of users on the system. 
```text
SELECT DISTINCT
course.fullname course,
CONCAT(user.firstname, ' ', user.lastname) AS 'Name',
user.email as 'Email',
user.city as 'City',
user.department as 'Department',
CASE
WHEN completions.timecompleted IS NOT NULL THEN ( FROM_UNIXTIME(completions.timecompleted, '%m-%d-%Y'))
ELSE '-Not Yet Completed-'
END AS 'Completion'



FROM prefix_course_completions AS completions
INNER JOIN prefix_course AS course ON completions.course = course.id AND course.visible = 1
INNER JOIN prefix_context AS cx ON course.id = cx.instanceid AND cx.contextlevel = '50'
INNER JOIN prefix_user AS user ON completions.userid = user.id AND user.deleted = 0 AND user.suspended = 0



INNER JOIN (SELECT vm.userid, vm.groupid, vg.id, vg.courseid, vg.name FROM prefix_groups_members AS vm
			INNER JOIN prefix_groups AS vg ON vg.id=vm.groupid
			INNER JOIN prefix_course AS c2 ON c2.id = vg.courseid
			WHERE vm.userid=%%USERID%%) AS groups ON groups.courseid = course.id



INNER JOIN prefix_groups_members AS members ON groups.id = members.groupid 
WHERE members.userid = user.id AND members.userid  %%USERID%% 
%%FILTER_COURSES:course.id%% 
%%FILTER_USERS:user.department%%



ORDER BY course
```

ResponsesInList.Text: Emma and Ron thank you for your solutions. I will see if I can get this to work for me and my situation.

ResponsesInList.Title: How can I create a SQL query that only shows courses that have moved into a particular category within the current month?
ResponsesInList.Text:
I have a query that shows the course creation date and the category they're in, but I can't see anything in mdl_logstore_standard_log, mdl_course or mdl_course_categories that I can use to create filter on when they were moved. When moving the course to another category, it creates this entry in the logstore_standard_log table: The query I'm running is a simple one: 
```text
select cat.name, c.* from mdl_course c


   join mdl_course_categories cat on cat.id = c.category


      and cat.path = '/15/' or cat.path like '/15/%'


order by 


   cat.name asc,


   c.fullname asc
```
 I want this query only to show courses that were moved into this categoryid within the current month. I know I can filter the log table on the timemodified column on each log entry (i.e. and date_format(from_unixtime(c.timemodified), '%Y-%m') = date_format(now(), '%Y-%m')) to show the courses that have been edited within the current month, but this doesn't capture the courses moving between categories. Does anyone have a solution for this they're willing to share? Much appreciated in advance!

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: How can I create a SQL query that only shows courses that have moved into a particular category within the current month?
ResponsesInList.Text: Matthew, The log event that this creates is one where the eventname is "\core\event\course_updated" and the action is "updated" as well. The target of course is "course". You can filter on that in your code.

```text
SELECT C.fullname coursename,L.userid,U.username,U.firstname, U.lastname,ra.roleid,L.action,'present' as Attendance,
```

ResponsesInList.Text: Hi there, I have a report that successfully counts the number of students and teachers in all courses. ```text    group_concat(distinct concat('',cat2.name,'') order by locate(concat('/', cat2.id, '/'), concat(cat1.path, '/')) separator ' > ') "full category path", ``` ```text    -- get the course's category name ``` ```text    concat('',cat1.name,'') "category name", ``` ```text    -- is this course visible to students? ``` ```text    case when cat1.visible = 1 ``` ```text         then 'yes' ``` ```text         else 'no' ``` ```text     end "visible to students", ``` ```text    -- get course name ``` ```text    concat('',c.fullname,'')  "diploma/certificate/unit name", ``` ```text    -- get group's name ``` ```text    g.name 'Group', ``` ```text    -- count the students and teachers in the course ``` ```text    -- N.B. this needs to change to 'count the students and teachers in each ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Issue with FILTER_COURSE
ResponsesInList.Text: FILTER_COURSE should be FILTER_COURSES and it matches on id, so you'd want to change your filter sql to: %%FILTER_COURSES:course.id%%

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Odp: Re: Letter Grade Report

You can tell the site default is used when the overridden column is null. -Ben ------ select c.id courseid, c.fullname course, u.id userid, concat(u.lastname, ', ', u.firstname) user, #percent rounded to 2 decimal places round(g.finalgrade,2) percent, #letter grade, uses any custom letters for the course (SELECT l.letter FROM mdl_grade_letters l join mdl_context x on l.contextid = x.id WHERE x.contextlevel = 50 and x.instanceid in (c.id, 0) and l.lowerboundary <= g.finalgrade ORDER BY x.id desc, lowerboundary desc limit 1) overridden_grade_scale, (SELECT l.letter FROM mdl_grade_letters l WHERE l.contextid = 1 and l.lowerboundary <= g.finalgrade ORDER BY l.lowerboundary desc limit 1) default_grade_scale, #this is the grade feedback from the gradebook, you could see this in SingleView g.feedback comments from mdl_user AS u join mdl_grade_grades g on g.userid = u.id join mdl_grade_items gi on gi.id = g.itemid JOIN mdl_course c on c.id = gi.courseid #Join relationship for student role in the course JOIN mdl_enrol AS en ON en.courseid = c.id JOIN mdl_user_enrolments AS ue ON ue.enrolid = en.id and ue.userid = u.id JOIN mdl_context AS ctx ON c.id = ctx.instanceid JOIN mdl_role_assignments AS ra ON ra.contextid = ctx.id and ra.userid = u.id JOIN mdl_role r on ra.roleid = r.id where gi.itemtype = 'course' #filter required for student role AND r.shortname = 'student' #specific userid and u.id = 86 #specific courseid and gi.courseid = 815

ResponsesInList.Title: Enrolment method count during last 7 days
ResponsesInList.Text: Hi all, I'm a first-time poster so apologies if I've posted in the wrong place or this questions has been asked before (I've had a look but couldn't find anything) I would like to write an SQL report that counts the number of enrolment methods by course. What I have so far is: SELECT c.fullname AS 'Course', e.enrol AS 'Method', Count(e.enrol) AS 'Count' FROM {user_enrolments} AS ue JOIN {enrol} AS e ON e.id = ue.enrolid JOIN {course} AS c ON c.id = e.courseid GROUP BY c.fullname, e.enrol However I would like the count to be for course enrolments started within the last 7 days. Could anyone please give me a little help? I'd really appreciate it Thanks Stuart

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Enrolment method count during last 7 days
ResponsesInList.Text: Stuart, In the user_enrolments table there are two columns, timecreated and timemodified. The created one is when the enrollment was first made (by whatever method). If it gets changed or edited after that for some reason, then the modified date holds that. You can use either one of those dates and add a WHERE clause to check that those dates are within the last seven days. There's a similar snippet of code you can use in this query https://docs.moodle.org/38/en/ad-hoc_contributed_reports#Users_loggedin_within_the_last_7_days over in the query repository page.

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Enrolment method count during last 7 days
ResponsesInList.Text: Thanks Randy, thats a great help! Really appreciate it!

ResponsesInList.Title: Configurable report showing all ACTIVE enrolments who have not logged in for the past 60+days
ResponsesInList.Text:
Howdy Moodle Community My boss has asked me to build a c onfigurable
report showing all ACTIVE enrolments who have not logged in for the past
60+days site wide. We are running Moodle 3.5 and I’ve installed the configurable block report and I’ve added
the report columns I require but have no idea on the exact conditions or filters need to be added to only see ACTIVE enrolments who have not logged into our site for the past 60+days. Can anyone step me through setting up the conditions or filters so I only see ACTIVE enrolments with no activity for the past 60+days? I know that this is probably considered basic Moodle knowledge but I'm admin level with no technical experience. Thanks in advance! Kym

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Configurable report showing all ACTIVE enrolments who have not logged in for the past 60+days
ResponsesInList.Text:
Kym, The status field in the mdl_user_enrolments table tells you the status of the the user's enrolment in the course, where 0 = active and 1 = suspended. So, something like 
```text
WHERE ue.status = 0
```
 checks for this. It may be different for different courses, of course. So what your boss thinks is "an active user" may vary from course to course. If you mean that a user account as a whole is active or not, that is shown in the mdl_user table in the suspended column, where 1 = true and 0 = false, meaning active. So active users will have a 0 there. 
```text
WHERE u.suspended = 0
```
 means all active users, leaving out suspended accounts.

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Configurable report showing all ACTIVE enrolments who have not logged in for the past 60+days
ResponsesInList.Text: Many thanks Randy!
