ResponsesInList.Title: User age
ResponsesInList.Text: I have setup a report that displays a column with the user birthday, which is a custom profile field. Is there any way to add a column that returns the user age? Thanks for your help, keep up the good work!

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: User age
ResponsesInList.Text:
Ok, since I wasn't able to find a non- sql way to return a column with an user's age among other data columns, I created the following query, that seems to work ok. I hope somebody finds it helpful: 
```text
SELECT
CONCAT(user2.firstname, " ", user2.lastname) AS Nombre,
# user2.email AS Email,
user2.city AS City,
course.fullname AS Course,
(SELECT name FROM prefix_role WHERE id=en.roleid) AS RoleName,

MAX(if(uif.shortname="DNI",uid.data,' ')) AS DNI,
MAX(if(uif.shortname="Sexo",uid.data,' ')) AS "Sexo",
MAX(if(uif.shortname="Fechadenacimiento",  TIMESTAMPDIFF(YEAR, FROM_UNIXTIME(uid.data), NOW()),' ')) AS "Edad",
MAX(if(uif.shortname="Nivelformativo",uid.data,' ')) AS "Nivel formativo",
MAX(if(uif.shortname="Situacinlaboral",uid.data,' ')) AS "Situación laboral",
MAX(if(uif.shortname="Provincia",uid.data,' ')) AS "Provincia",
MAX(if(uif.shortname="Noticiadelaula",uid.data,' ')) AS "Noticia",
MAX(if(uif.shortname="Experiencia",uid.data,' ')) AS "Experiencia",
MAX(if(uif.shortname="Razndecursoonline",uid.data,' ')) AS "Razón online"

FROM prefix_course AS course 
JOIN prefix_enrol AS en ON en.courseid = course.id
JOIN prefix_user_enrolments AS ue ON ue.enrolid = en.id
JOIN prefix_user AS user2 ON ue.userid = user2.id
JOIN prefix_user_info_data AS uid ON uid.userid = user2.id
JOIN prefix_user_info_field AS uif ON uid.fieldid = uif.id

WHERE course.id=%%COURSEID%%

GROUP BY user2.id
```
 The rows starting with "MAX" are a way to return rows as columns, as explained here

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Can I filter per group?
ResponsesInList.Text: This isn't specifically a filter by group but can be once downloaded to Excel but I run this enrolment report that pulls group membership.  Hopefully you can pull out the group stuff and adjust it for one of your reports. SELECT DISTINCT c.shortname, usr.firstname, usr.lastname, usr.city, groups.name FROM mdl_course AS c INNER JOIN mdl_context AS cx ON c.id = cx.instanceid AND cx.contextlevel = '50' AND c.category = '4' INNER JOIN mdl_role_assignments AS ra ON cx.id = ra.contextid INNER JOIN mdl_role AS r ON ra.roleid = r.id INNER JOIN mdl_user AS usr ON ra.userid = usr.id INNER JOIN mdl_groups AS groups ON c.id = groups.courseid INNER JOIN mdl_groups_members AS members ON groups.id = members.groupid WHERE members.userid = usr.id AND r.name = "Student" ORDER BY groups.name

ResponsesInList.Title: Deleting automatic course backup files - possible through Configurable Reports?
ResponsesInList.Text: Greetings - and thanks ahead of time for any assistance. The short version of my question is, Can I use Configurable Reports to delete automated backup files after I have identified them? And more specifically, What should I do with the information returned from the particular Contributed Ad-hoc report described below? And I’ll ask forgiveness ahead of time, as well, for what may be a poorly worded post (I am not a sysadmin or anything close to that, but I do most of our Moodle administration). The longer version: I would like to delete the automated course backups from our Moodle installation. After installing the Configurable Reports block I’ve identified almost 48 GB of these automated backup files. I’ve been working in our test server (Moodle 2.9.2+ Build: 20151014) - a clone of our production server) and have done the following:

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Deleting automatic course backup files - possible through Configurable Reports?
ResponsesInList.Text:
David, I am not sure why you want to remove the files? If the answer is to just clear out disk space? If it were me, I would leave the files there, if they are not causing any issues for you. There is no telling what type of issues you might create deleting files you do not really know (all) the purposes for. You wrote, The report returned 47.5625 ( space taken by backup files
in GB, right?) I will also guess that is MB not GB, in my opinion........ 48 MB is not a huge amount of space on a server. I do database related work all the time. I would not think a report is going to have delete rights to the database files. A report generally would only have read rights. If you really want to see the actual file sizes, have the database admin give you read only access to the actual database and write a query to bring the file data you want back, then you can really see file size and etc..... If I mis-understand your reasoning.........just ignore. haha

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Deleting automatic course backup files - possible through Configurable Reports?
ResponsesInList.Text: ﻿ Rick, Thanks for the rapid response. I’m wanting to remove them for a couple of reasons. I would like to start directing the backups to a location outside of Moodle, but I would like to try to “reset” the pickup process, if possible. We have a few hundred courses that are not being backed up correctly - “Error”, “Unfinished”, or “Automated backup pending”. Or, even if I am not given a new directory location, I’d still like to restart the backup process. I know that the automated course backups are not the thing for disaster recovery, but they seem convenient for the scenario where a teacher has a problem that can only be solved by turning the dial back on her course to the previous day. I have tried backing up some of the affected courses manually, through the Administration block backup option - with debugging turned on - and get the following (on all courses I've tried, not just the problem ones), but I believe that I’ve read that this is not a problem (although it does have the word, “warning”) The backup file was successfully created. Technical information and warnings setting controller status to 700 saving controller to db calculating controller checksum 9a81a46157dab1d2605466f56e7d923e loading controller from db setting controller status to 800 setting controller status to 1000 saving controller to db I think the 47.5625 is GB. We have over 3000 courses and the report script includes 1024*1024*1024. I thought the same as you about a report - that it would only “report”, not make changes/deletions - even with the report listed on the Ad-hoc Contributed Reports page as “Delete all the automated backup files”. But I am noticing something. As I visit courses and click on "Restore" in the course admin settings,  there is no longer an Automatic Backups section at the bottom of the page. This has been true for every course I’ve examined - but only 6 or so at this point. There is no discernible change, however, in the size of the /filedir directory. Maybe this is one of those one- or four-day processes and Moodle will clean the files out over time? I did disable automatic backups so that new backups would not be created, but I don’t think that would eliminate the Automated backups section in individual courses. Thanks, again for the reply! David

ResponsesInList.Title: Need help finding the correct report to use
ResponsesInList.Text: I am interested in being able to create a report in Moodle 2.8 where people with specific permissions are easily able to go to a spot (like a block), select a link (like "Completion Report"), select a specific "Group" or " Grouping ," and run a site-wide report. The information returned would be a list of their specific Group of participants and the Date of Completion for the courses that each of them have taken. Further, the structure of the platform that I have inherited are set up as metacourses (group of courses from the Master List) or "Course Tracks" ... where Student A may be in Course Track 1 taking courses Alpha, Beta, Gamma, Delta, and Student B make take courses Alpha, Beta and Epsilon from Course Track 2. But in our reporting, we need to see both Student A and Student B on the same report, even though they are in different Course Tracks. There are so many elements to use in Moodle, I need some suggestions for the best way to create this report. I see it much like the Course Completion Report, only that it would gather all Course Completion Dates from courses site-wide for a specific Group from a pull-down menu at the top of the page. Does the fact that it exists in a Metacourse mean anything to the reporting function? Can I set up an independent, site-wide report that can be accessed (with permissions) by others? And keep in mind, courses have already started for the year so I don't want anything that will damage the integrity of the existing data. Any help of direction would be appreciated. Thank you!

ResponsesInList.Title: Configurable Reports in Single Activity Format Courses
ResponsesInList.Text: Hello, We're working with a client who needs to report on forums, which essentially make up the material of their Single Activity Format courses.  They require reporting on the gender (custom profile field) of the user and the dates they posted.  I created and tested a Configurable Report on test site and then when I went to add it to their Single Activity Format course, there was no option to add the Configurable Reports block (which is installed).  Is there a way that I can access these forums with Configurable reports to Single Activity Format courses...or a work around? Also, is it possible to report on documents posted to the forum? Thanks! Erin Moodle 2.7.3

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Configurable Reports in Single Activity Format Courses
ResponsesInList.Text: The whole idea of configurable reports is that you can create reports across the whole site.  You do not need to add it to the course - you could actually limit the report to those courses by adding a filter in your sql query to just select courses with that format.  Or at least list course format and then you can filter from Excel when you download your data.  If you want individual course reports just add a course number filter and filter that way.

ResponsesInList.Title: Add submission status to individual grade report

ResponsesInList.Title: Help to build a report: new user accounts per month
ResponsesInList.Text: Hi everyone, I'd like to build a custom report to measure how many new users we get every month. But I know nothing about databases and I'm feeling lost! Can you give me a hand? Thanks in advance!

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Help to build a report: new user accounts per month
ResponsesInList.Text: Try this one. SELECT d.DATE, d.COUNT FROM ( SELECT u.timecreated, DATE_FORMAT(FROM_UNIXTIME(u.timecreated), '%M %Y')AS DATE, SUM(IF(u.deleted=0,1,0)) AS COUNT

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Help to build a report: new user accounts per month
ResponsesInList.Text: Thank you very much! That's exactly what I was looking for.

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Help to build a report: new user accounts per month
ResponsesInList.Text: Very effective! Is there a way to extend this so just the username is appended into brackets in the report rows? e.g. March 2015 (jsmith, cmith, jcitizen, ...) 5 April 2015 (fsmith, jlaws, ...) 13 Thank you for any help.

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Help to build a report: new user accounts per month
ResponsesInList.Text:
You are already selecting from the mdl_user table so just add the username column, like this (roughly and untested!): 
```text
SELECT


    d.DATE,


    d.COUNT,


    '(' + d.username + ')'


FROM


    (


      SELECT


        u.timecreated,


        DATE_FORMAT(FROM_UNIXTIME(u.timecreated), '%M %Y') AS DATE,


        u.username,


        (CASE WHEN (u.deleted = 0) THEN 1 ELSE 0 END) AS COUNT


      FROM


        mdl_user AS u


      GROUP BY


        YEAR(FROM_UNIXTIME(u.timecreated)) MONTH(FROM_UNIXTIME(u.timecreated)), u.username, u.deleted


    ) AS d
```

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Need help creating SQL report for certificates
ResponsesInList.Text:
Try the following - works on my Moodle 2.7.3 with MS SQL 2012 backend; should work with other DB backends by adjusting any lines converting date timestamp from Convert (date, dateadd(s, <fieldname>, '1970-01-01')) to from_unixtime(<fieldname>) 
```text
SELECT u.username as 'User Name', 


    Convert (date, dateadd(s,ci.timecreated, '1970-01-01')) AS 'Certificate Date',


    c.name AS 'Course Name', sc.value AS 'Result', uinfod.data AS 'RAGCP',


    Convert (date, dateadd(s,cc.timestarted, '1970-01-01')) AS 'Course Started Date',


    sc.value AS 'Result'


  FROM {user} AS u


    JOIN {certificate_issues} AS ci ON u.id = ci.userid


    JOIN {certificate} AS c ON ci.certificateid = c.id


    JOIN {course_completions} AS cc ON cc.course = c.course AND u.id = cc.userid


    JOIN {scorm} as s ON s.course = cc.course


    JOIN {scorm_scoes_track} AS sc ON u.id = sc.userid AND sc.scormid = s.id


    JOIN {user_info_field} AS uinfof ON uinfof.name = 'RACGP'
```

Convert (date, from_unixtime(<fieldname>)) AS 'Certificate Date', c.name AS 'Course Name', sc.value AS 'Result', uinfod.data AS 'RAGCP', Convert (date, from_unixtime(<fieldname>)) AS 'Course Started Date', sc.value AS 'Result' FROM mdl_user AS u JOIN mdl_certificate_issues AS ci ON u.id = ci.userid JOIN mdl_certificate AS c ON ci.certificateid = c.id JOIN mdl_course_completions AS cc ON cc.course = c.course AND u.id = cc.userid JOIN mdl_scorm as s ON s.course = cc.course JOIN mdl_scorm_scoes_track AS sc ON u.id = sc.userid AND sc.scormid = s.id JOIN mdl_user_info_field AS uinfof ON uinfof.name = 'RACGP' JOIN mdl_user_info_data AS uinfod ON uinfod.userid = u.id AND uinfod.fieldid = uinfof.id WHERE sc.element = 'cmi.core.score.raw' ORDER BY 'Certificate Date' LIMIT 0, 5000 [array ( )] Error code: dmlreadexception Stack trace: line 443 of /lib/dml/moodle_database.php: dml_read_exception thrown line 1019 of /lib/dml/mysqli_native_moodle_database.php: call to moodle_database->query_end() ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Need help creating SQL report for certificates
ResponsesInList.Text:
Hi Federica, you need to use some MySQL-ish, as suggested by Kevin by means of place holders ( <fieldname> ) i.e.: 
```text
SELECT


    u.username as 'User Name',


    FROM_UNIXTIME(
ci.timecreated
) AS 'Certificate Date',


    c.name AS 'Course Name',


    sc.value AS 'Result',


--
    uinfod.data AS 'RAGCP', 


    FROM_UNIXTIME(
cc.timestarted
) AS 'Course Started Date', 


    sc.value AS 'Result' 


FROM mdl_user AS u 


JOIN mdl_certificate_issues AS ci ON u.id = ci.userid 


JOIN mdl_certificate AS c ON ci.certificateid = c.id 


JOIN mdl_course_completions AS cc ON cc.course = c.course AND u.id = cc.userid 


JOIN mdl_scorm as s ON s.course = cc.course 


JOIN mdl_scorm_scoes_track AS sc ON u.id = sc.userid AND sc.scormid = s.id 


--
 JOIN mdl_user_info_field AS uinfof ON uinfof.name = 'RACGP' 


--
 JOIN mdl_user_info_data AS uinfod ON uinfod.userid = u.id AND uinfod.fieldid = uinfof.id 


WHERE sc.element = 'cmi.core.score.raw'
```
 Note: you should comment out even the custom profile field, IF you don't use it. HTH , Matteo

Here is what I am using right now: SELECT concat('',course.fullname,'') AS Course ,concat('Show users') AS Users , COUNT(course.id) AS Students FROM prefix_role_assignments AS asg JOIN prefix_context AS context ON asg.contextid = context.id AND context.contextlevel = 50 JOIN prefix_user AS USER ON USER.id = asg.userid JOIN prefix_course AS course ON context.instanceid = course.id WHERE asg.roleid = 5 GROUP BY course.id ORDER BY COUNT(course.id) DESC Can anyone assist or get me started in the right direction?

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Course Enrollment Method Report
ResponsesInList.Text:
The following will show a total count for enrollment methods in all courses. 
```text
SELECT c.fullname AS 'Course',

       Count(e.enrol) AS 'Count'
```

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: A report to show which categories a user is enroled on.
ResponsesInList.Text: Hi, If you're using ad'hoc report, you can directly use this to have a report of roles assignments on categories : ```text SELECT concat('',cc.id,'') AS id, concat('',cc.name,'') AS category, cc.depth, cc.path, r.name AS role, concat('',usr.lastname,'') AS name, usr.firstname, usr.username, usr.email FROM prefix_course_categories cc INNER JOIN prefix_context cx ON cc.id = cx.instanceid AND cx.contextlevel = '40' INNER JOIN prefix_role_assignments ra ON cx.id = ra.contextid INNER JOIN prefix_role r ON ra.roleid = r.id ``` HTH , Séverin

ResponsesInList.Title: Crowd-funding for Configurable Reports? Some thoughts about the future of the plugin
ResponsesInList.Text: Hi all, During these last days I've been thinking about the future of the plugin. As you may know, Moodle 2.8 will come with a new report builder based on Totara Report Builder. (See https://tracker.moodle.org/browse/MDL-30193 for more info) When the news came out my first thought was to discontinue/deprecate the plugin and create a final version including a tool for migrating reports to the new system. The last comments in the previous tracker link has raise some new points to consider: - The new report builder will NOT support SQL reports - There is a lot of people using Configurable Reports (CR) with lots of reports created/contributed - It seems that the new report builder tool will not suit all the user needs in its first version Also, my personal and professional position has changed. Until now, I was able to "maintain" the plugin thanks to projects in my former employee and spending some spare/free time but now I don't have time for that. I was toying with the idea of starting a crowd-funding project to guarantee the maintenance of the plugin during the following year, including upgrades to Moodle 2.8, Moodle 2.9 and bug fixes. I was thinking rewards like fixing bugs pointed out by the contributors. The estimate for a complete year maintenance project is around 3000€ ($3800 approx.) What do you think? would you be willing to fund it?

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Crowd-funding for Configurable Reports? Some thoughts about the future of the plugin
ResponsesInList.Text: This may or may not be a good thing Juan. But I suspect posting here in an obscure little forum may not get a big audience.  I'm not sure what to suggest. I'll have a think. Good luck. -Derek

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Crowd-funding for Configurable Reports? Some thoughts about the future of the plugin
ResponsesInList.Text: I think i is a good idea and definitely worth giving it a shot. See https://moodle.org/mod/data/view.php?id=8090 - it's not very popular but maybe it's time to expose it a bit more. There are surely many companies that do use that functionality and would easily contribute few hundred EUR for maintenance. You should try that and put information in the visible places - like your plugin main description. Maybe some people would sponsor it if you could add "supported/sponsored by company X" on the plugin page? Just an idea. Tomek

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Crowd-funding for Configurable Reports? Some thoughts about the future of the plugin
ResponsesInList.Text: Hi Juan I've used Configurable Reports for many years, and along with Tim's Ad-hoc SQL Reporting these have been the two "go to" plugins for reporting, and we've promoted them to others (clients, at Moots, etc.) However, I feel that the report builder that's been adopted for core is going to be the tool that 90% of people will use, simply because it is in core. I think the whole area of logs and reporting is not yet right, but maybe it will get better over the next few releases. If enough people feel that CF is able to offer something valuable, and it can do things better or different to the basic functionality of the in-built report builder, then HRDNZ might consider sponsoring the ongoing development of this - as long as we can clearly show our sponsorship. Stu

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Crowd-funding for Configurable Reports? Some thoughts about the future of the plugin
ResponsesInList.Text:
Juan, I've spent time with the Report builder in Totara with several projects over the last year, so I am familiar with what it can do. I'd agree with what Stuart said: it will cover what most people ask for in reports and do a fine job, even if not all the advanced features it has will make it to core at first. It's already a rich and mature tool. Clearly people who are now using CR for the user/course/category type reports will be able to replicate those in the new Report builder, if not right away, then eventually by rebuilding them. I think a bridge converter from CR to Report builder
would be very useful thing , but those who do have a lot
of standard reports now in CR should raise their voices to be heard on
this issue if they want to continue CR for a while until they can
convert over. Since the OU Ad-Hoc plugin handles only SQL and already has good scheduling abilities, it can continue to fill in that gap which the Report builder will not have. Though I work a lot in CR, I happily use AD when I need the scheduling and email notices.  Almost all my client reporting work, though, is with direct SQL, not the standard type reports. So, although I really enjoy CR and have promoted it whenever I can, if it was discontinued, AD would continue to serve most of my SQL reporting needs.  (I suspect I am not in the majority situation though.) Randy

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Crowd-funding for Configurable Reports? Some thoughts about the future of the plugin
ResponsesInList.Text: I can't live without the report features. I'd love to support the project.

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Crowd-funding for Configurable Reports? Some thoughts about the future of the plugin
ResponsesInList.Text: Well, it seems that finally the report builder will not be available for Moodle 2.8 so I'm thinking in starting a crowdfunding project in order to upgrade the plugin to 2.8 and fix the most voted bugs in the tracker Cheers, Juan

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Crowd-funding for Configurable Reports? Some thoughts about the future of the plugin
ResponsesInList.Text: I have no real objection to making OU Ad-Hoc plugin available to teachers in a course somhow, providing it can be done in a way that does not mess up the code too much. If someone is interested in trying to implement that, please contact me (e.g. by posting in this thread) with an outline of how you think it could be made to work.

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Crowd-funding for Configurable Reports? Some thoughts about the future of the plugin
ResponsesInList.Text: The approach we've taken so far is to work on adding the scheduling features of the Ad-Hoc plugin to Configurable Reports, but if it makes more sense to go the other way, that would be fine. Overall, the ability to control access to the reports by role (beyond just the single "Report user" role that grants access to all reports) is critical. CR provides some interesting ways for users to build reports using a form-based interface, but we don't use that as much, and I suppose the solution that will eventually be included in Core may take over that functionality. CR provides its own display block, but that's probably not critical, since everyone gets the Administration block in some form or another. The other feature I appreciate in CR is the ability to import contributed reports from a repository. If we were going to make Ad-Hoc Reporting a more general-purpose tool, this could be a helpful addition.

ResponsesInList.Title: SQL for percentage of course completed
ResponsesInList.Text:
Hi, I'm using a custom report to get some summary information about various scorm courses. I've got most of the data I need, but there's one column that I can't work out how to calculate. We need the percentage of the course that each user has completed. I must admit that I'm far from an expert in this area, I've basically cobbled together the SQL from the list of useful queries in the ad-hoc custom reports documentation. Here's the SQL I'm using: 
```text
SELECT u.firstname, u.lastname, c.shortname, 


DATE_FORMAT(DATE(FROM_UNIXTIME(ue.timestart)), '%d/%m/%Y') start_date,


SEC_TO_TIME(SUM( TIME_TO_SEC( t.value ) ) ) total_time,


ROUND(gg.finalgrade / gg.rawgrademax * 100 ,2) AS final_grade


FROM prefix_course c


JOIN prefix_context ctx ON c.id = ctx.instanceid


JOIN prefix_role_assignments ra ON ra.contextid = ctx.id


JOIN prefix_user u ON u.id = ra.userid


JOIN prefix_grade_grades gg ON gg.userid = u.id


JOIN prefix_grade_items gi ON gi.id = gg.itemid


JOIN prefix_course_categories cc ON cc.id = c.category
```
 My question is, is it possible to extract / calculate the percentage of the course that's been completed for each user? I've been looking around the query examples and the database schema but I'm a bit lost... if anyone can help me and point me in the right direction it'll be greatly appreciated! Many thanks Dave

ResponsesInList.Title: Need help to add Groups FIlter?
ResponsesInList.Text:
Hello Everyone, I am currently using this sql . 
```text
SELECT g.name AS groupname, c.shortname AS coursename, mu.username, CONCAT(mu.lastname, ', ',mu.firstname) AS fullname, gg.finalgrade AS finalgrade 
FROM prefix_grade_items AS gi 
INNER JOIN prefix_course c ON c.id = gi.courseid 
LEFT JOIN prefix_grade_grades AS gg ON gg.itemid = gi.id 
INNER JOIN prefix_user AS mu ON gg.userid = mu.id 
LEFT JOIN prefix_groups_members AS gm ON mu.id = gm.userid 
LEFT JOIN prefix_groups AS g ON gm.groupid = g.id 
WHERE gi.itemtype = 'course' 
%%FILTER_COURSES:l.course%% 
ORDER BY g.id desc
```
 I wanted to have a filter for groups and when selected will only show all users that belong to the group. How do I do this? Thank you!

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Need help to add Groups FIlter?
ResponsesInList.Text:
Hello, I have improved my SQL and did this instead. 
```text
SELECT
	groups.name AS "Group",
	users.username, 
	CONCAT(users.lAStname, ', ',users.firstname) AS "Full Name",
	courses.fullname AS "Course Name",
	ROUND(grades.finalgrade, 2) AS "Total Grade",
	CASE 
		WHEN grades.finalgrade > 90 THEN 'Excellent'
		WHEN grades.finalgrade > 70 THEN 'PASsed'
		WHEN grades.finalgrade > 0  THEN 'Failed'
		WHEN grades.finalgrade = 0  THEN 'Incomplete'
     ELSE 'N/A'
	END AS "Remarks"
FROM prefix_user AS users
INNER JOIN prefix_grade_grades AS grades ON grades.userid = users.id
LEFT OUTER JOIN prefix_grade_items AS gradeitems ON grades.itemid = gradeitems.id AND gradeitems.itemtype = 'course'
INNER JOIN prefix_course AS courses ON courses.id = gradeitems.courseid
LEFT OUTER JOIN prefix_groups_members AS groupmembers ON users.id = groupmembers.userid
LEFT OUTER JOIN prefix_groups AS groups ON groupmembers.groupid = groups.id AND courses.id = groups.courseid
WHERE 1=1
%%FILTER_COURSES:courses.id%%
%%FILTER_SEARCHTEXT:groups.name:~%%
ORDER BY groups.name, courses.sortorder, users.lAStname ASC
```
 Right now, I can filter by group by using the search text filter. The drawback is you have to know the name of the group. I hope that there is a group filter instead. Any improvement is welcome/ Thank you.

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: User filter - first name not working properly
ResponsesInList.Text: I found the solution of user field problem. Type of fuserfield is set to PARAM_INT in components/filters/fuserfield/plugin.class file. Changing it to PARAM_BASE64 at the end of the file solves the issue. $mform->setType('filter_fuserfield_'.$data->field, PARAM_BASE64); Thanks, Amit Yadav

ResponsesInList.Title: Custom Profile Fields in Separate Columns
ResponsesInList.Text:
Thanks to this great thread ( https://moodle.org/mod/forum/discuss.php?d=240087 ) I was able to figure out how to create a report that would include information from one of our custom profile fields. What I would like to do now is figure out if / how I can include two (or more) custom profile fields in a report so that they would show up in SEPARATE columns. We are currently using three custom profile fields with the following shortnames: state | librarytype | workplace. Here is my SQL report which is working correctly and including the 'state' field. 
```text
SELECT u.username, u.email, uif.shortname, uid.data, c.shortname,
DATE_FORMAT(FROM_UNIXTIME(p.timecompleted
),'%Y-%m-%d') 
AS completed

FROM prefix_course_completions AS p
JOIN prefix_course AS c ON p.course = c.id
JOIN prefix_user AS u ON p.userid = u.id
JOIN prefix_user_info_data AS uid ON uid.userid = u.id
JOIN prefix_user_info_field AS uif ON uid.fieldid = uif.id
WHERE c.enablecompletion = 1  and uif.shortname = 'state' and p.timecompleted >(UNIX_TIMESTAMP(DATE_ADD(CURDATE(),INTERVAL -30 DAY)))
ORDER BY u.username
```
 I would like to create a report that included both 'state' and 'workplace' custom fields and displayed them in separate columns in the same row. Any help is appreciated. Thanks!

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Custom Profile Fields in Separate Columns
ResponsesInList.Text:
```text
SELECT u.username, u.email, uid.data AS state, uif2.data AS workplace, c.shortname,
DATE_FORMAT(FROM_UNIXTIME(p.timecompleted
),'%Y-%m-%d') 
AS completed

FROM prefix_course_completions AS p
JOIN prefix_course AS c ON p.course = c.id
JOIN prefix_user AS u ON p.userid = u.idJOIN prefix_user_info_data AS uid ON uid.userid = u.id
JOIN prefix_user_info_field AS uif ON uid.fieldid = uif.id


JOIN prefix_user_info_data AS uid2 ON uid2.userid = u.id
JOIN prefix_user_info_field AS uif2 ON uid2.fieldid = uif2.id


 WHERE c.enablecompletion = 1  and uif.shortname = 'state' and uif2.shortname = 'workplace' and p.timecompleted >(
UNIX
_TIMESTAMP(DATE_ADD(CURDATE(),INTERVAL -30 DAY)))
```

ResponsesInList.Title: Is THIS possible: meta links and reporting?
ResponsesInList.Text: I have 20 courses which I have brought together using meta links. I now need to generate a completion report for all 20 course. When I generate a report though, it only shows the first course (to which all other courses are linked to). Did I miss anything when I linked the courses or this is simply not the purpose of meta linking courses, i.e. I need to enroll them to each of the 20 courses? Thanks!

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Is THIS possible: meta links and reporting?
ResponsesInList.Text: The way meta works is that the main course, the meta course, should contain all the activities and resources including the completion statuses for all users. The other courses should be simply providing the enrollment information that syncs to the main course. You don't normally enroll users in the main meta course directly: that's what the children are for. (That's the basic scenario; there are variations.) So, running the report should do just that: give you completion for that main, meta course. So it is working properly. So if you enroled everyone in the meta course but not in any of the 20 child courses, then there was no point in making it a meta course because it has its own enrolments directly and not via synching from the child courses. You are not going to get an activity completion report in one course to know about anything in other courses. You'd have to do a custom report in something like Configurable reports to do that.

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Is THIS possible: meta links and reporting?
ResponsesInList.Text: Thanks for taking the time to explain Randy. Let me see if I understood you correctly. I need to create a (main) course and add the 20 courses as links. At the same time, each of the 20 courses needs to be linked to the main via meta links. Next, I will need to enroll them to each course except the main course. (I am under the impression that if I linked all the child courses to the parent, I only needed to enroll the users on the parent course and they will automatically see all 20 courses.) Lastly, I need to create a custom report that will pull completion rates from the individual courses. Is this correct?

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Is THIS possible: meta links and reporting?
ResponsesInList.Text: That sounds right except for this part: "(I am under the impression that if I linked all the child courses to the parent, I only needed to enroll the users on the parent course and they will automatically see all 20 courses.) " They wouldn't see all 20 courses, but should see just two: the child course they were enroled in and the main meta course with the content. A person would not be enroled in or need to see the other child courses. That is assuming the usual method where all the child courses hold enrolments and sync them to the one main meta course. Do you have content in all 20 courses? Do any users need to be enroled in any of those beside the main meta course? Are are those just sources of enrolment information?

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Is THIS possible: meta links and reporting?
ResponsesInList.Text:
Do you have content in all 20 courses? Yes. Do any users need to be enroled
in any of those beside the main meta course? They need to be enrolled on all 20 courses. Which is why I assumed that if all 20 were pointing to the main course (via meta course links), I would only need to enroll them to the main course. Are are those just sources
of enrolment information? Sorry, I'm not sure I understand this question. Can you please elaborate or rephrase the question?

ResponsesInList.Title: Students by course reports
ResponsesInList.Text: I found the contributed students by course report didn't always report the correct role[*] and wasn't very useful for my site, so I wrote two new ones.  The first is total students for a course.  The second only shows current students (in other words it removes students whose enddate on the enrollment is in the past).  Both of them eliminate non-visible courses as we have a number of them used for templates and so on, and we don't want to clutter the report.  At the end of a course we'll plan on hiding it, and next trimester we don't want them showing up in the report either. The main difference with the contributed one is that it start with role_assignments, not user_enrollments.  The reason is that user_enrollments doesn't have the actual role.  It has a like to an enrol record for the plugin instance which shows the current default role, but that could have changed, or could be overridden depending on the plugin. Caveat: it's certainly possible that I don't fully understand the structure of some of these tables.  In particular if a student was enrolled in a via more than one enrollment plugin, with overlapping dates, it probably double counts that student. We use the enrol_apply plugin for enrollment, and it seems to work fine with that. Anyone is welcome to use these: Total students in a course (uses role assignments, not the user enrollments table, so I think it's more accurate) select count(ra.userid) as "Total Students", c.fullname as "Course Name" from role_assignments ra, prefix_context ctx, prefix_course c where ra.contextid = ctx.id and ctx.contextlevel = 50 and c.id = ctx.instanceid and ra.roleid = 5 and c.visible=1 group by ctx.id Current students in a course (links back to the user_enrollment, which as far as I can see is the only place with the date range for the enrollment): select count(ra.userid) as "Current Students", c.fullname as "Course Name" from role_assignments ra, prefix_context ctx, prefix_course c, prefix_enrol e, prefix_user_enrolments ue where ra.contextid = ctx.id and ctx.contextlevel = 50 and c.id = ctx.instanceid and ra.roleid = 5 Feel free to give any comments, suggestions, or if it doesn't work properly with your configuration I will try to improve or fix it.

ResponsesInList.Title: Combining queries
ResponsesInList.Text:
The results of a query I created from two different queries is not returning the same results. Query A 
```text
SELECT 


 c.fullname Course


 u.firstname First,


 u.lastname Last,


 u.id ID,


 u.institution Company


 


 FROM (mdl_scorm_scoes_track AS st)


 JOIN mdl_user AS u ON st.userid=u.id


 JOIN mdl_scorm AS sc ON sc.id=st.scormid


 JOIN mdl_course AS c ON c.id=sc.course


 Join mdl_user_enrolments AS uenr ON uenr.userid=u.id


 Join mdl_enrol AS enr ON enr.id=uenr.enrolid
```
 Query B 
```text
SELECT


 c.fullname AS Course,


 u.firstname AS Firstname,


 u.lastname AS Lastname,


 u.id AS ID,


 u.institution AS Company


 


 IF (u.lastaccess = 0,'never',


 DATE_FORMAT(FROM_UNIXTIME(u.lastaccess),'%Y-%m-%d')) AS dLastAccess


 


 ,(SELECT DATE_FORMAT(FROM_UNIXTIME(timeaccess),'%Y-%m-%d') FROM mdl_user_lastaccess WHERE userid=u.id AND courseid=c.id) AS CourseLastAccess 


 FROM mdl_user_enrolments AS ue


 JOIN mdl_enrol AS e ON e.id = ue.enrolid


 JOIN mdl_course AS c ON c.id = e.courseid


 JOIN mdl_user AS u ON u.id = ue.userid


 LEFT JOIN mdl_user_lastaccess AS ul ON ul.userid = u.id


 WHERE ul.timeaccess IS NULL AND (DATEDIFF(NOW(), FROM_UNIXTIME(ue.timecreated))>60)


 ORDER BY u.id, c.fullname
```
 I have combined them into Query C 
```text
SELECT


 c.fullname AS Course,


 u.firstname AS Firstname,


 u.lastname AS Lastname,


 u.id AS IDNumber,


 u.institution AS Institution,


 


 IF (u.lastaccess = 0,'never',


 DATE_FORMAT(FROM_UNIXTIME(u.lastaccess),'%Y-%m-%d')) AS dLastAccess


 


 ,(SELECT DATE_FORMAT(FROM_UNIXTIME(timeaccess),'%Y-%m-%d') FROM mdl_user_lastaccess WHERE userid=u.id AND courseid=c.id) AS CourseLastAccess


 


 


 FROM mdl_user_enrolments AS ue


 JOIN mdl_enrol AS e ON e.id = ue.enrolid


 JOIN mdl_course AS c ON c.id = e.courseid


 JOIN mdl_user AS u ON u.id = ue.userid


 LEFT JOIN mdl_user_lastaccess AS ul ON ul.userid = u.id


 WHERE (ul.timeaccess IS NULL OR ue.userid IN


 (SELECT u.id 


 FROM (mdl_scorm_scoes_track AS st)


 JOIN mdl_scorm AS sc ON sc.id=st.scormid


 


 WHERE c.id=sc.course AND st.userid=u.id AND (st.value='incomplete' OR st.value='not attempted') 


 )


 )AND (DATEDIFF(NOW(), FROM_UNIXTIME(ue.timecreated))>60)


 ORDER BY c.fullname, u.lastname,u.firstname
```
 I have not found where my logic is incorrect in Query C. Query C is adding an incorrect record not found by either A or B and duplicating entries in a couple of cases. I would like some pointers on where my logic on combining the 2 went astray. The purpose of the queries is to identify anyone that has been enrolled in a SCORM course and has not accessed or completed that course within 60 days.

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Combining queries
ResponsesInList.Text: Can't you just combine the two queries with a UNION?

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Combining queries
ResponsesInList.Text: At first glance, it seems that the inner joins are building the desired result table but the Left join is stacking two separate tables into the result table that is not related to the previous joins. For e.g. student john smith has a record in the enrolments table, match his record in the enrol table based on the enrolments table, then match his course he's taking in the enrolments table to the courses in the courses table,) this is where I believe the query breaks down -> then match anyone with a last access to  anyone that has a userid limiting the result set to the where clause. To prove the thought remove the where clause and you may have duplicate entries for everybody who has a userid and last access. As Tim mentioned you may be able to union the two queries or what I have found success in is creating views. Create a view of all users enrolled in the SCORM courses then run a query against the view limiting to the date ranges you have specified.  There is also the approach of creating a temporary table to hold the result set from the inner joins and then running a second query all in the same script that filters the table by date. Hope that helps. Phil Templeton

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Combining queries
ResponsesInList.Text: I will have to look more at how UNIONs work to determine if it will provide what I am looking for.  I hadn't questioned the LEFT JOIN, as I took that query from user contributed queries and after a few fixes it seemed to work as I expected.  I will also have to look into that. In case this helps, my intent is to list all users that have been enrolled into a course but within a given timeframe, have not logged into the system, accessed the course or, finally, have not completed the SCORM activity in the course. So the logic I am looking for is: If the user has not logged in within 60 days - display name If logged in but has not accessed the course within 60 days - display name If logged in and has accessed the course but has not completed the course activity- display name Query A does list all users that started the activity but have not completed within 60 days. Query B does list all users that have not logged in or accessed the course within 60 days or at least it appears that way.  The problem with Query A was that it also lists users that started the SCORM activity but are no longer enrolled in the course. Query C did correct the problem with Query A and did exclude those users that did not complete and were unenrolled.

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Combining queries - resulting query
ResponsesInList.Text:
I ended up starting from scratch to create the query I was looking for.  I eliminated the duplicates by using DISTINCT.  Based on the existing data I had, this did return the correct number of items. This query will return a list of all users that: 1. Have been enrolled as a STUDENT in a course more than 30 days, AND 2a. Have never logged in or accessed the course, OR 2b. Have not completed the course and obtained a score. I have ignored the use of the context table to ensure that I was only looking at a course as our setup is only using SCORM bsed courses, so not sure if this will work for others. 
```text
SELECT DISTINCT 


c.fullname Course, 


u.lastname 'last name', 


u.firstname 'first name', 


u.idnumber 'ID number',


(DATE_FORMAT(FROM_UNIXTIME(ue.timemodified),'%Y-%m-%d')) 'Enrolled on', 


IF (ul.timeaccess is NULL,'never',


DATE_FORMAT(FROM_UNIXTIME(ul.timeaccess),'%Y-%m-%d')) 'Last Accessed on', 


(DATEDIFF(NOW(), FROM_UNIXTIME(ue.timecreated))) 'Days Enrolled'




FROM prefix_user_enrolments ue


JOIN prefix_user u ON u.id=ue.userid


JOIN prefix_enrol en ON en.id=ue.enrolid


JOIN prefix_course c ON c.id=en.courseid


LEFT JOIN prefix_user_lastaccess ul ON (ul.courseid=c.id AND ul.userid=ue.userid)


JOIN prefix_role_assignments ra ON ra.userid=ue.userid


JOIN prefix_role as r ON r.id=ra.roleid


JOIN prefix_grade_items gi ON gi.courseid=c.id


LEFT JOIN prefix_grade_grades gg ON (gg.userid=ue.userid AND gg.itemid=gi.courseid)




WHERE ue.status=0 AND (DATEDIFF(NOW(), FROM_UNIXTIME(ue.timecreated))>30) AND r.name='student' AND (gg.finalgrade is NULL OR gg.finalgrade = 0) 




ORDER BY c.fullname, u.lastname, u.firstname
```
 Currently this lists all courses.  if you use this in Configurable Reports and add a filter for courses add then add the following on the line before ORDER BY. 
```text
%%FILTER_COURSES:c
.
id%%
```

ResponsesInList.Title: Add multiple Profile fields to report
ResponsesInList.Text: I would like to run a report that shows Division, Business Unit, User Name, Course Name and Grade (so I can report to each division on whether their staff have done all the courses they should). Division and Business Unit are both user_info_data table (because they're both User Profile Fields).  I have worked out how to include one of these values in the report using the code below; but I can't easily change this code to include the Business Unit too. Do you have an idea how I could do this?  Thank you. SELECT uid.data AS 'Division', u.username AS 'User Name', c.fullname AS 'Course', ROUND(gg.finalgrade,0) AS 'Grade' FROM prefix_user AS u JOIN prefix_grade_grades as gg ON u.id = gg.userid JOIN prefix_grade_items as gi ON gi.id = gg.itemid JOIN prefix_course as c ON c.id = gi.courseid JOIN prefix_user_info_data AS uid ON u.id = uid.userid JOIN prefix_user_info_field as uif ON (uid.fieldid = uif.id AND uif.shortname = 'div') WHERE u.deleted = 0 ORDER BY uid.data, u.username, c.fullname, gg.finalgrade

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: May be time-out? Getting a blank-page while downloading large report
ResponsesInList.Text: Moodle.org had some database corruption. See https://moodle.org/mod/forum/discuss.php?d=243129 . Whenever you get a blank page, your first move should be to turn on Debugging . Then you will get an error message, which will give you some idea what the problem is.

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: May be time-out? Getting a blank-page while downloading large report

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: How to list only active courses in the Courses filter?
ResponsesInList.Text: Hi Kimber, I finally had a brainwave in this - although it requires modifying the filter slightly. File moodle\blocks\configurable_reports\components\filters\courses\plugin.class.php From about line 80, below is my modifications if(!empty($courselist)){ list($usql, $params) = $DB->get_in_or_equal($courselist); $sort='fullname'; //To sort course by name $select='visible=1'; //to only show those that are visible $courses = $DB->get_records_select('course',$select,$params, $sort); //replaces $courses = $DB->get_records_select('course',"id $usql",$params); This now sorts only active courses by username in the dropdown filter.

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: activity and grades report
ResponsesInList.Text: Raphael, You need to look at the lists of sql contributed reports and then adapt it your precise needs. This query may get you started: SELECT prefix_user.city AS PSA, prefix_user.lastname, prefix_user.firstname, prefix_grade_items.itemname, ROUND(prefix_grade_items.grademax, 0) AS maxgrade, ROUND(prefix_grade_grades.finalgrade, 0) AS finalgrade, DATE_FORMAT( FROM_UNIXTIME( prefix_grade_grades.timemodified) , '%m/%d/%Y' ) AS DATE FROM prefix_grade_grades INNER JOIN prefix_user ON prefix_grade_grades.userid = prefix_user.id INNER JOIN prefix_grade_items ON prefix_grade_grades.itemid = prefix_grade_items.id WHERE (prefix_grade_items.itemname IS NOT NULL) AND (prefix_grade_items.itemtype = 'mod' OR prefix_grade_items.itemtype = 'manual')

ResponsesInList.Title: Can I write 1 SQL report to generate viewer-dependent data?
ResponsesInList.Text: Can I, as an admin, write one SQL report intended for teachers to use, which dynamically includes only the courses relevant to the viewer? ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Can I write 1 SQL report to generate viewer-dependent data?
ResponsesInList.Text: I have the same request. But in my case, I want this report (always the same report) only to be included in certain courses. I would like to avoid creating hundreds of the same reports.

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Can I write 1 SQL report to generate viewer-dependent data?
ResponsesInList.Text: I use MS SQL database so you will need to modify my references below for whatever databas you use. Check the Permissions tab.  Use either the Report capability AND/OR Create a role (duplicated from your Student Role and modify), and add permissions; Example: C1 - Report Capabilities C2 - User with the selected role/s in the current report course C3 - Any user in the current report course (C1 OR C2) AND C3 or In your query you limiit what is viewed only to those of the same Cohort or UserID of the user viewing the report. For the example below, I am seperating the query by everyone with the same first 2 digits of their USERNAME which is basicly their group/location identifier from LDAP userid. Example list of users: 01joesmith 01janesmith 01jimwrite 04johnadams 04janeadams 07bobedwards Example pre-query to seperate by USERNAME DECLARE @myuserid VARCHAR(2) SELECT @myuserid = LEFT(username,2) FROM prefix_user AS u WHERE u.id = %%USERID%% ..query... AND LEFT(u.username,2) = @myuserid So if 01joesmith ran this report/query, he would get all the data for users of the same IDs, which in this example would list data for; 01joesmith 01janesmith 01jimwrite Note: If you create a report/query on the Front Page is becomes a Site Wide report and lists ALL Data not specific to any one course. If you create a report/query on the Course Page is useually only queries data specific to that Course.

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Summarizing elapsed Student time in each lesson
ResponsesInList.Text:
I defined a different strategy to obtain the result of summarizing elapsed time in a lesson. 1. Each lesson but the first one contains a dependency from previous lesson based on elapsed time in minutes. 2. Defined a summary query on the table 'prefix_lesson_timer'. As far as understood (unfort did not found documentation) the 'prefix_lesson_timer' is used to track the time spent in lessons in order to check the time constraint (1) and it may contain multiple records for lesson/user. My query (I'm using configurable report to run sql queries) looks like: 
```text
select 
     c.id as courseid,
     t.lessonid, 
     t.userid,
     u.username as UserName,
     c.shortname as CourseName,
     l.name as LessonName, 
     sum(((t.lessontime-t.starttime)/60)) as SpentTime 
from 
     prefix_course c, 
     prefix_lesson l, 
     prefix_user u, 
     prefix_lesson_timer t
where
     t.lessonid = l.id and
     t.userid = u.id and
     l.course = c.id 
group by userid, courseid, lessonid
```
 Ciao Massimo

ResponsesInList.Title: New version of the Ad-hoc database queries (customsql) report release
ResponsesInList.Text: I have just put out a new version of this plugin . Notable new features include: Better handling of dates. If a column has a name ending in 'date' and contains integer values, then they will be assumed to be unix timestamps, and formatted as dates. If a query placeholder has a name ending in 'date', then users will be give a date-time selector to input the value of that parameter. Thanks to Mahmoud Kassaei of the Open University, UK. Laura McLeod (OU) also deserves thanks for incredibly patient testing, and finding lots of things that Mahmoud and I missed during development. Ability to change the limit on the number of rows returned. We still won't let you increase beyond hard limit of REPORT_CUSTOM SQL _MAX_RECORDS = 5000 (unless you edit the code) but you can now make a query to return the top 10 of something. Thanks to Troy Williams or The University of Waikato, NZ. If the report you are trying to create returns an error, then the full database error is displayed on the editing form. Thanks to Tim Hunt, the Open University, UK. This should work with all versions of Moodle 2.2 -> 2.5. As ever, let us know if you encounter any problems.

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: 404 - File or directory not found.
ResponsesInList.Text: I have managed to resolve this issue. The problem was that the sql was wrong! I changed the sql to be the following :- SELECT COUNT(l.id) hits, l.course, c.fullname 'Course name' FROM prefix_log l INNER JOIN prefix_course c ON l.course = c.id GROUP BY l.course, c.fullname ORDER BY hits DESC I still dont know why the system gave me a 404 error. I did find that by turning on debug and running the code on an IE browser at the web server , that I got some debug response that indicated a problem with the SQL, so that led me on the path of re-writing the query. The original query was cut and pasted from the configurable reports examples link List of SQL Contributed reports and these examples may be pertinent only to MySql , whereas I am using MSSQL 2008. So that might explain the debug message about the wrong sql statement.

ResponsesInList.Title: Configurable Reports in French + other features
ResponsesInList.Text: Hi Juan, First, thank you for Configurable Reports! It's an essential tool for anyone tailoring Moodle for a particular situation. Configurable Reports as it stood did not completely fill our needs so I modified the code. We would like to share these features with the community. If you believe any of these changes could be useful to other users I'd be very happy to assist in integrating them to the plugin's main branch! Here is the patch in diff format: http://pastebin.com/csgh3fQk If I can share this in any other form which would be more pratical to you, don't hesitate to say so. We've added the following features: We had Configurable Reports translated to French! I modified the User Field filter so that it may be used in custom SQL reports. I would particularly appreciate your review of that change. I added a User Field Search Box filter which behaves similarly to the User Field filter, except that the value is entered in a text field instead of being chosen from a select box. We built that to search for a particular user by username in a database bound to eventually contain thousands of users. I modified viewreport.php so that redirection does not happen after output has started. In custom SQL reports, I added support for a %%WWWROOT%% keyword, which is subsituted for $CFG-> wwwroot . In custom SQL reports also, I added string replacements on SQL queries so that "?" does not break the query (necessary to allow for hyperlinks as column values). I modified the button label that applies a filter to a report to "Apply" and the first option for the selection menu to "All". These may be somewhat debatable changes but we found more natural to "apply" a filter to a report since "add" sounds like we are adding data. Similarly, choosing the first option in a filter's select box displays all data, so we preferred "all". The following changes are nitpicking application of some good practices I thought relevant: Defining SomeClass::__construct() and SomeClass::SomeClass() issues notices. I removed all SomeClass::SomeClass() constructors. Some StdClass objects were used without declaration, which issues notices. I added declarations when appropriate. I removed ?> from the end of all PHP files so that response headers aren't sent when they aren't supposed to. Relevant discussion: http://stackoverflow.com/questions/3219383/why-do-some-scripts-omit-the-closing-php-tag Best Regards, François Moreau

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Configurable Reports in French + other features
ResponsesInList.Text: Hi François, thanks for sharing your contributions! Can you attach here the full code of your configurable report personalization? It will help me a lot for integrating your improvements and changes. You can also publish your version in github. Regards

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Configurable Reports in French + other features
ResponsesInList.Text: Hi Juan, You're welcome! It seems it's finally time for me to get on github. It'll give me the opportunity to organize the changes in neat commits. It's my first time with this tool, so hopefully I won't mess up the pull request. Regards, François

ResponsesInList.Title: Exporting XLS with number fields
ResponsesInList.Text: First of all, thanks a bunch for this great module Juan, it's been a life-saver! One thing we found was that when we exported a report to an XLS file, cells that we thought should have been formatted as numbers in Excel, were treated as text instead. To fix this issue, we made one small change to the /configurable_reports/export/xls/export.php file around line 60, changing the line from: $myxls->write_string($ri,$ci,$cv); to: $myxls->write($ri,$ci,$cv); This allows the Moodle library's Worksheet class to determine the data type itself. I don't know if this change causes other problems or not, but thought I'd pass it on in case others were having this problem, and also to see if you'd like to change this code in the master version of this block.

ResponsesInList.Title: Query to count course logins
ResponsesInList.Text: I need to approximate how many times a student has "logged in" to a particular course. Since students don't truly "log in" to a course, they only login to the entire Moodle system, I need to write a SQL query that will approximate the "course logins" for me. One approach that comes to mind would be to count the number of times a student has entered a course starting from a page not within that same course. In other words, when a student views a main course page by navigating from a different course or from the MyMoodle page. I can count the number of times a student has viewed a main course page by writing something like SELECT COUNT(log.id) AS 'Session Count', c.fullname AS 'Course', u.lastname AS 'User' FROM prefix_log AS log JOIN prefix_course AS c ON c.id=log.course JOIN prefix_enrol AS e ON e.courseid=c.id JOIN prefix_user_enrolments AS ue ON ue.enrolid=e.id JOIN prefix_user AS u ON u.id=ue.userid WHERE log.action='view' AND log.module='course' AND log.userid=u.id GROUP BY u.lastname but that includes all the times a student has returned to the main course page from an activity in the same course. Does anyone have any idea how I can specify that the original link to the course has to come from outside the course itself? I hope I've been clear enough. I'll be happy to clarify anything.

ResponsesInList.Title: SQL Query Help Selecting Custom User Fields

The custom user fields are located in the mdl_user_info_data table. Get the state you would SELECT data FROM mdl_user_info_data WHERE fieldid = 1 Get the role you would SELECT data FROM mdl_user_info_data WHERE fieldid = 2 SELECT cc.timecompleted AS datecompleted, cc.course AS id, cc.userid AS user, c.id AS courseid, c.shortname AS course, u.userid AS userinfoid, (u.data FROM u WHERE u.fieldid = 1) AS state, (u.data FROM u WHERE u.fieldid = 2) AS role FROM mdl_course_completions cc JOIN  mdl_course c ON (cc.course = c.id) JOIN mdl_user_info_data u ON (cc.userid = u.userid) WHERE cc.timecompleted >= 0 Any help would be greatly appriciated. ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Moodle 2.2

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Moodle 2.2

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Moodle 2.2
ResponsesInList.Text: That is a hard limit in Oracle, and therefore the coding guidelines say that all table names must be at most 28 characters long (without the prefix). The XMLDB editor enforces this, so you should not have been able to create a table name that long in the first place.

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Install Fails on 2.3

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Install Fails on 2.3
ResponsesInList.Text: The file db\access.php still references the admin role which has been renamed to manager (hence the error).  It should still install fine (though I haven't tried 2.3 yet and it might be more picky than 2.2). ResponsesInList.Text: Hi; I'm using CR to extract grades to roll-up into an MS Access DB that we've constructed, but some grades are not being shown. I think this is due to grades that have been manually entered by teachers , so I'm assuming that I'm missing a CASE statement for another table, etc.?? Here's the SQL I'm trying: SELECT DISTINCT u.firstname AS 'FirstName', u.lastname AS 'LastName', u.idnumber AS 'EmployeeID', gi.ID AS 'CompID', gi.ItemName AS 'Component', ROUND(gg.finalgrade,1) AS 'finalgrade', FROM_UNIXTIME(gg.timemodified) AS 'DateModified' FROM prefix_user u JOIN prefix_role_assignments ra ON ra.userid = u.id JOIN prefix_context ct ON ct.id = ra.contextid AND ct.contextlevel = 50 JOIN prefix_course c ON c.id = ct.instanceid JOIN prefix_role r ON r.id = ra.roleid JOIN prefix_course_categories cc ON cc.id = c.category WHERE r.id =5 AND ct.instanceid = c.id AND gi.itemtype = 'mod' AND gg.rawgrade > 0 AND u.idnumber <> '' AND u.deleted = 0 AND ct.contextlevel = 50 ORDER BY c.sortorder, u.username, gi.itemname, gg.timemodified Any help, of course, greatly appreciated. ResponsesInList.Title: Re: GRADES SQL: Trouble with extracting grades! Any help appreciated
ResponsesInList.Text: This may not be of any help, but I remember looking at the tables to figure out why every time I changed the grading method of the gradebook (from average to highest, or highest to median, etc), uploaded grades disappeared and only grades produced as the result of a SCORM attempt stayed in the gradebook. I noticed there was nothing in the "rawgrade" column of the table for uploaded grades... they only appeared in the "finalgrade."  When I changed the grading method, it seemed to remove anything that was in final grade and replace it with whatever was in rawgrade. Maybe gg.rawgrade > 0 is keeping your uploaded grades from showing, as an uploaded grade of "100" would show "0" in gg.rawgrade, but "100" in gg.finalgrade -Mark

ResponsesInList.Title: FTP report
ResponsesInList.Text: Hi all, Is it possible for a report we have running using this block to be sent via FTP as a XLS, csv file to a local server . Or run the report and save it locally on the server as a csv XLS file? Thanks, Matt

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: FTP report
ResponsesInList.Text: Here's how we do something similar. I'm using Windows with IIS and MySQL database . The default prefix we use is "mdl_". 1. On the server should be a folder "C:\Program Files\My SQL \MySQL Server 5.5\bin" 2. Take the SQL commands you have written and copy-and-paste them to a text file in this folder called 'XPORT.SQL' (make sure to change "prefix_" to "mdl_" in the file) 3. Create a batch file in that folder called 'XPORT.BAT' with the following command: mysql.exe -- host =HOSTNAME --user=USERNAME --password=PASSWORD --database=moodle19 < XPORT.SQL > OUTPUT.DAT Where: HOSTNAME is the servername (or could be 'localhost') USERNAME is the name of the user of the database PASSWORD is the password of the above-named user moodle19 is the name of the database (yours could be different) XPORT.SQL is the file you created above with your SQL commands OUTPUT.DAT is the TAB-DELIMITED file to be created (it will still open in Excel) 4. Execute XPORT.BAT at the command line. This will create OUTPUT.DAT 5. Once you have the OUTPUT.DAT created you can create an FTP command file. It will have the commands needed to send the file to the recipient. You only need to create this file once. It should look something like this: OPEN ftp.whatever.com USER username PASS password HASH BINARY SEND OUTPUT.DAT (other commands necessary) CLOSE BYE Where: OPEN <site> - makes the connection to the recipients server USER <username> - the username they probably gave you to login PASS <password> - the password for the account HASH - will show "#" characters as each block is sent (this line is optional) BINARY - indicates to the recipients FTP server that the file you are sending is binary SEND <filename> - this command tells the receiving FTP server that you are sending a file (use GET if this is a file you are getting from them) CLOSE - disconnectes from the remote server BYE - quits the local FTP program 6. You then execute this file by using the following command at the command line: FTP -S:XPORT.TXT This can be added to the end of the XPORT.BAT file, if you like. I'm unsure of your general skill level so if you have problems with any of this, let me know.

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Displaying course Dedication time in hours

'Second'  : 'Seconds'; $sm = ($mins == 1)  ? 'Minute'  : 'Minutes'; $sh = ($hours == 1) ? 'Hour' : 'Hours'; $ohours = ''; And called this function. Thank you very much. Vinit

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: New plugin: Custom reports
ResponsesInList.Text: Hi, you can find a example here: http://docs.moodle.org/en/blocks/configurable_reports/#Creating_a_SQL_Report For creating new filters you need to program in PHP, take a look to the existing ones in components/filter you will have to modify problaby also the sql report code in reports/sql You need php skills and some Moodle knowledge to understand how it works, it's not complicated Regards

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: New plugin: Custom reports
ResponsesInList.Text: Hi Juan Leyva, I couldn't get start and end filters work exactly in my sql report type and my course filter is working fine. Here is my sql query. Could you please judge me with the right syntax to get START AND END FILTERS. SELECT c.fullname, c.shortname FROM prefix_course c,prefix_reenroll r WHERE r.courseid=c.id AND 1%%FILTER_COURSES:c.id%% GROUP BY courseid

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: New plugin: Custom reports
ResponsesInList.Text:
The table reenroll needs a field called time to work: SELECT c.fullname, c.shortname FROM prefix_course c,prefix_reenroll r WHERE r.courseid=c.id AND 1%%FILTER_COURSES:c.id%%
%%FILTER_STARTTIME:r.time:>%% %%FILTER_ENDTIME:r.time:<%% GROUP BY courseid

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: New plugin: Custom reports
ResponsesInList.Text: In my database the reenroll table has field "enrolleddate" which stores the values in date format as "YYYY-MM-DD". I am unable to get the result using the filter u provided...CAN U PLZ HELP ME OUT...????? Also  if i want to add a new filter of my own,what shall i do..?????

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: New plugin: Custom reports
ResponsesInList.Text: The date format must be timestamp, It doesn't work with other formats See previous messages about adding a new filter in this same post Regards

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: New plugin: Custom reports
ResponsesInList.Text: Thank you juan Now i cannot change my database fields in unix timestamp,Can u provide me any other better alternative....????

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: New plugin: Custom reports
ResponsesInList.Text: Two alternatives Create a new field in the same table with the date in timestamp format. Use a cron job for updating every X minutes the date in timestamp format or modify the components/filters/datetime code of the plugin Regards
